    Even the women who were at home divided the spoil.
68.13:
Though you sleep between the sheepfolds,
    yet you will be like the wings of a dove overlaid with silver,
    and its feathers with yellow gold.
68.14:
When the Almighty scattered kings in it,
    it was white as snow on Mount Zalmon.
68.15:
The mountain of God is as the mountain of Bashan;
    a mountain of many peaks like the mountain of Bashan.
68.17:
The chariots of God are twice ten thousand, even thousands of thousands;
    the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
68.18:
You have ascended on high,
    You have led captivity captive;
    You have received gifts from people,
yes, even from the rebellious,
    that the Lord God might dwell among them.
68.19:
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loads us with benefits,
    even the God who is our salvation. Selah
68.20:
That God is for us, the God of saving acts;
    and to God the Lord belongs escape from death.
68.21:
But God will shatter the head of His enemies,
    and the scalp of one who walks in his trespasses.
68.22:
The Lord said, “I will cause them to return from Bashan,
    I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea,
68.23:
that your foot may stomp in the blood of your enemies,
    and the tongue of your dogs may have a portion in it.”
68.24:
They have seen Your processions, O God,
    the processions of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
68.26:
Bless God in the congregations,
    the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
68.27:
There is little Benjamin leading them,
    the princes of Judah and their throng of people,
    the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
68.28:
Your God has commanded your strength;
    strengthen, O God, what You have done for us.
68.29:
From Your temple above Jerusalem,
    kings will bring gifts to You.
68.30:
Rebuke the animals that live among the reeds,
    the herd of bulls, with the calves of the people,
until everyone submits himself with pieces of silver;
    scatter peoples who delight in war.
68.31:
Ambassadors will come out of Egypt;
    Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God.
68.32:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth;
    oh, sing praises to the Lord; Selah
68.33:
to Him who rides on the heavens, the ancient heavens;
    He who sends out His voice, a mighty voice.

69.1:
Save me, O God!
    For the waters have come up to my throat.
69.4:
Those who hate me without cause
    are more than the hairs of my head;
they are mighty
    who would destroy me, being my wrongful enemies,
so that I must pay back
    what I did not steal.
69.5:
O God, You know my folly,
    and my sins are not hidden from You.
69.6:
May those who wait on You,
    O Lord God of Hosts,
    not be ashamed because of me;
may those who seek You
    not be humiliated because of me,
    O God of Israel.
69.7:
Because for Your sake I have endured insult;
    humiliation has covered my face.
69.8:
I have become estranged to my relatives,
    and a foreigner to my mother’s children;
69.9:
for the zeal of Your house has consumed me,
    and the insults of those who insulted You fell on me.
69.10:
When I wept with fasting for my soul,
    it became an insult to me.
69.11:
I also made sackcloth my garment,
    and I became a byword to them.
69.12:
Those who sit in the gate speak against me,
    and I am the song of the drunkards.
69.13:
But as for me, my prayer is to You, O Lord;
    in an acceptable time, O God,
in the abundance of Your mercy,
    answer me in the truth of Your salvation.
69.14:
Deliver me out of the mire
    that I may not sink;
may I be delivered from those who hate me,
    and out of the watery depths.
69.16:
Answer me, O Lord, for Your lovingkindness is good;
    turn Your face to me according to the abundance of Your tender mercies.
69.17:
Do not hide Your face from Your servant,
    for I am in trouble; answer me quickly.
69.18:
Draw near to my soul, and redeem it;
    deliver me because of my enemies.
69.19:
You have known how I am insulted, and my shame and my dishonor;
    my adversaries are all before You.
69.21:
They also gave me poison for my food,
    and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
69.22:
May their table become a snare before them,
    and may security become a trap.
69.23:
May their eyes be darkened so they do not see,
    and make their sides shake continually.
69.24:
Pour out Your indignation on them,
    and may Your wrathful anger overtake them.
69.25:
May their habitation be desolate,
    and may no one dwell in their tents.
69.26:
For they persecute him whom You have struck down,
    and they recount the pain of those You have wounded.
69.27:
Add punishment to their iniquity,
    and do not let them come into Your righteousness.
69.28:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
    and not be written along with the righteous.
69.29:
But I am poor and in pain;
    may Your salvation, O God, set me secure on high.
69.30:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
    and will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
69.31:
This also will please the Lord
    more than an ox or bull with horns and hoofs.
69.32:
The humble will see this and be glad;
    and you who seek God, may your heart live.
69.33:
For the Lord hears the poor,
    and does not despise His prisoners.
69.34:
Let heaven and earth praise Him,
    the seas and everything that moves in them.
69.36:
The descendants of His servants will inherit it;
    and those who love His name will dwell in it.

70.1:
Make haste, O God, to deliver me!
    Make haste to help me, O Lord.
70.2:
May those who seek my life
    be ashamed and confused;
may those who desire my harm
    be driven back and humiliated.
70.3:
May they turn back as a consequence of their shame
    who say “Aha! Aha!”
70.4:
May all those who seek You
    rejoice and be glad in You;
and may those who love Your salvation continually say,
    “God be magnified!”

71.1:
In You, O Lord, I seek refuge;
    may I never be put to shame.
71.2:
Deliver me in Your righteousness and help me escape;
    incline Your ear to me and save me.
71.4:
Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,
    out of the hand of the unjust and cruel man.
71.5:
For You are my hope, O Lord God;
    You are my confidence from my youth.
71.7:
I am like a wondrous sign to many;
    You are my strong refuge.
71.8:
My mouth will be filled with Your praise
    and with Your glory all the day.
71.9:
Do not cast me off in the time of old age;
    do not forsake me when my strength fails.
71.10:
For my enemies speak against me;
    and those who watch for my life take counsel together,
71.12:
O God, do not be far from me;
    O my God, act quickly to help me.
71.14:
But I will hope continually,
    and will add to all Your praise.
71.15:
My mouth will declare Your righteousness
    and Your salvation all the day,
    for I cannot know their numbers.
71.16:
I will go in the strength of the Lord God;
    I will make mention of Your righteousness, of Yours only.
71.17:
O God, You have taught me from my youth;
    and until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous works.
71.18:
Now also when I am old and gray,
    O God, do not forsake me,
until I have proclaimed Your strength to this generation,
    and Your power to everyone who is to come.
71.20:
You who have shown me great distresses and troubles
    will revive me again,
and will bring me up again
    from the depths of the earth.
71.21:
You will increase my greatness,
    and You will encircle and comfort me.
71.22:
I will give You thanks with the harp,
    even Your truth, O my God;
to You I will sing with the lyre,
    O Holy One of Israel.
71.23:
My lips will rejoice
    when I sing to You,
    and my soul, which You have redeemed.

72.1:
Give the king Your judgments, O God,
    and Your righteousness to the king’s son.
72.2:
May he judge Your people with righteousness,
    and Your poor with justice.
72.3:
May the mountains bring well-being to the people,
    and the hills, in righteousness.
72.4:
May he judge the poor of the people,
    may he save the children of the needy,
    and crush the oppressor.
72.5:
May they fear You as long as the sun endures,
    and the moon, throughout all generations.
72.6:
May he descend like rain on the mown grass,
    as showers dripping on the earth.
72.7:
In his days may the righteous flourish,
    and abundance of peace until the moon is no more.
72.8:
May he have dominion from sea to sea,
    and from the River to the ends of the earth.
72.9:
May those who dwell in the wilderness bow before him,
    and his enemies lick the dust.
72.11:
May all kings bow down before him;
    may all nations serve him.
72.12:
Indeed, may he deliver the needy when he cries;
    the poor also, and him who has no helper.
72.13:
May he have compassion on the poor and needy,
    and save the lives of the needy.
72.14:
May he redeem their life from deceit and violence;
    and may their blood be precious in his sight.
72.18:
Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel,
    who alone does wondrous deeds.
72.20: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

73.1:
Truly God is good to Israel,
    to the pure in heart.
73.2:
But as for me, my feet almost stumbled;
    my steps had almost slipped.
73.3:
For I was envious at the boastful;
    I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
73.4:
For there are no pains in their death;
    their bodies are fat.
73.5:
They are not in trouble as other people;
    nor are they plagued like others.
73.6:
Therefore pride is their necklace;
    violence covers them as a garment.
73.7:
Their eyes bulge with fatness;
    they have more than a heart could wish.
73.8:
They mock and speak with evil oppression;
    they speak loftily.
73.9:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
    and their tongue struts through the earth.
73.10:
Therefore people turn to them,
    and abundant waters are drunk by them.
73.11:
They say, “How does God know?
    And is there knowledge with the Most High?”
73.12:
Observe, these are the wicked, always at ease;
    they increase in riches.
73.13:
Surely I have kept my heart pure for nothing,
    and washed my hands in innocence.
73.14:
For all the day long I am plagued,
    and chastened every morning.
73.15:
If I said, “I will speak thus,”
    I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.
73.16:
When I thought to understand this,
    it was troublesome in my eyes,
73.17:
until I went into the sanctuary of God;
    then I understood their end.
73.18:
Surely You have set them in slippery places;
    You have brought them down to ruin.
73.19:
How they come to desolation, as in a moment!
    They have come to an end, utterly consumed with terrors.
73.20:
As a dream when one awakes,
    so, O Lord, when You awake,
    You will despise their form.
73.21:
Thus my heart was embittered,
    and I was pierced in my feelings.
73.22:
I was a brute and did not understand;
    I was as a beast before You.
73.23:
Nevertheless I am continually with You;
    You have held me by my right hand.
73.24:
You will guide me with Your counsel,
    and afterward receive me to glory.
73.25:
Whom have I in heaven but You?
    And there is nothing on earth that I desire besides You.
73.26:
My flesh and my heart fails,
    but God is the strength of my heart
    and my portion forever.
73.27:
For those who are far from You will perish;
    You destroy everyone who is unfaithful to You.

74.1:
O God, why have You cast us off forever?
    Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
74.2:
Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old,
    the rod of Your inheritance, which You have redeemed,
    this Mount Zion, where You have lived.
74.3:
Move Your footsteps to the perpetual desolations,
    to all the harm the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
74.4:
Your enemies roar in the midst of Your meeting place;
    they set up their miracles for signs.
74.5:
They seem like men who lift up axes
    on a thicket of trees.
74.6:
But now they strike down its carved work altogether
    with axes and hammers.
74.7:
They have cast fire into Your sanctuary;
    they have defiled the dwelling place of Your name to the ground.
74.8:
They said in their hearts, “Let us destroy them together.”
    They have burned up all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.10:
O God, how long will the adversary scorn?
    Will the enemy blaspheme Your name forever?
74.11:
Why do You withdraw Your hand, Your right hand?
    Draw it out of Your bosom and destroy them!
74.12:
For God is my King of old,
    working salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.13:
You divided the sea by Your strength;
    You broke the heads of the dragons on the waters.
74.14:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan in pieces,
    and gave him for food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
74.15:
You split the fountain and the flood;
    You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
74.16:
The day is Yours, the night also is Yours;
    You have prepared the light and the sun.
74.17:
You have established all the borders of the earth;
    You have made summer and winter.
74.18:
Remember this, that the enemy has scorned, O Lord,
    and that the foolish people have blasphemed Your name.
74.19:
Do not give the life of Your turtledove to a wild animal;
    do not forget the life of Your poor forever.
74.20:
Have regard for the covenant;
    for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.
74.21:
May the oppressed not return ashamed;
    may the poor and needy praise Your name.
74.22:
Arise, O God, plead Your own cause;
    remember how the fool insults You daily.
74.23:
Do not forget the voice of Your enemies,
    the tumult of those who rise up against You continually.

75.2:
When I select an appointed time,
    I will judge with equity.
75.3:
Though the earth and all its inhabitants are swaying,
    I steady its pillars. Selah
75.4:
I said to the boastful, “Do not boast,”
    and to the wicked, “Do not lift up your horn.
75.5:
Do not lift up your horn on high,
    or speak with an arrogant neck.”
75.6:
For neither from the east nor west,
    nor from the wilderness comes victory.
75.7:
But God is the judge;
    He brings one low, and lifts up another.
75.8:
For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup,
    and it is full of mixed, foaming wine,
and He pours from it;
    surely all the wicked of the earth will find and drink its dregs.
75.9:
But I will declare forever,
    I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75.10:
All the horns of the wicked I will cut off,
    but the horns of the righteous will be exalted.

76.1:
In Judah God is known;
    in Israel His name is great.
76.2:
In Salem is His abode,
    and His dwelling place in Zion.
76.3:
There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow,
    the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah
76.4:
You are more glorious and excellent
    than the mountains of prey.
76.6:
At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
    both the chariot and horse lay stunned.
76.7:
You, even You, are to be feared;
    and who may stand in Your sight from the moment of Your anger?
76.8:
From the heavens You gave their judgment,
    and the earth feared and was silent,
76.9:
when God arose to judgment,
    to save all the meek of the earth. Selah
76.10:
Surely the wrath of people shall bring You praise;
    the remainder of wrath You shall put on.
76.12:
He reduces the spirit of princes,
    and is feared among the kings of the earth.

77.1:
I cried out to God with my voice,
    even to God with my voice; and He listened to me.
77.3:
I remember God, and I groan;
    I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah
77.4:
You hold my eyelids open;
    I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77.5:
I have considered the days of old,
    the years long ago.
77.7:
“Will the Lord cast off forever,
    and will He be favorable no more?
77.8:
Has His mercy ceased forever,
    and have His promises failed for all time?
77.9:
Has God forgotten to be gracious,
    and has He in anger shut up His tender mercies?” Selah
77.10:
Then I said, “This is my grief;
    yet I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.”
77.11:
I will remember the works of the Lord;
    surely I will remember Your wonders of old.
77.12:
I will meditate also on all Your work
    and ponder on Your mighty deeds.
77.13:
Your way, O God, is holiness;
    what god is as great as our God?
77.14:
You are the God who can do wonders;
    You have declared Your strength among the nations.
77.15:
You have with Your arm redeemed Your people,
    the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
77.19:
Your way is through the sea,
    and Your path in the great waters,
    and your footsteps are not seen.
77.20:
You led Your people like a flock
    by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.1:
Give ear, O my people, to my teaching;
    incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
78.2:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
    I will utter insightful sayings of old,
78.3:
which we have heard and known,
    what our fathers have told us.
78.4:
We will not hide them from their children,
    but will tell the coming generation
the praises of the Lord,
    and His strength, and the wonderful works that He has done.
78.5:
For He established a rule in Jacob,
    and appointed a law in Israel,
which He commanded our fathers
    that they should make them known to their children,
78.6:
that the generation to come might know them,
    even the children who are not yet born,
    who will arise and declare them to their children:
78.7:
that they might set their hope in God
    and not forget the works of God,
    but keep His commandments,
78.8:
and they might not be as their fathers,
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation that did not set their heart steadfast,
    and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
78.9:
The people of Ephraim, being armed with bows,
    turned back in the day of battle.
78.10:
They did not keep the covenant of God
    and refused to walk in His law;
78.11:
and they forgot His works
    and the wonders that He had shown them.
78.12:
In the sight of their ancestors He did marvelous wonders
    in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
78.13:
He divided the sea and caused them to pass through,
    and He made the waters to stand as a heap.
78.14:
In the daytime He led them with a cloud,
    and all the night with a light of fire.
78.15:
He split rocks in the wilderness
    and gave them abundance to drink as out of the great depths.
78.16:
He brought streams out of the rock
    and caused waters to run down like rivers.
78.17:
They sinned yet more against Him
    by provoking the Most High in the wilderness.
78.18:
They tested God in their heart
    by demanding the food that they craved.
78.19:
They spoke against God by saying,
    “Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
78.20:
Behold, He struck the rock, so that the waters gushed out
    and the streams overflowed.
Can He give bread
    or provide meat for His people?”
78.22:
because they did not believe in God
    nor trust in His deliverance.
78.23:
Yet He had commanded the skies above
    and opened the doors of heaven,
78.24:
and He rained down manna upon them to eat
    and gave them the grain of heaven.
78.25:
Man ate the food of mighty angels;
    He sent them bread in abundance.
78.26:
He caused an east wind to blow in the heavens,
    and by His power He brought out a south wind.
78.27:
He rained meat on them as dust,
    and winged birds as the sand of the sea;
78.28:
and He let them fall in the midst of their camp
    all around their habitations.
78.29:
So they ate and were satisfied,
    for He gave them their own desire;
78.30:
while they were not yet filled up,
    and while the meat was still in their mouths,
78.31:
the wrath of God came upon them,
    and He killed the strongest of them
    and struck down the young men of Israel.
78.32:
For all this they sinned still,
    and did not believe despite His wondrous works.
78.33:
Therefore He made their days vanish like a breath,
    and their years in trouble.
78.34:
When He killed them, then they sought Him;
    they turned back and longed for God.
78.35:
They remembered that God was their rock,
    and the Most High God their redeemer.
78.36:
Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouth,
    and they lied to Him with their tongues;
78.37:
for their heart was not devoted to Him,
    neither were they committed to His covenant.
78.38:
But He being full of compassion
    forgave their iniquity
    and did not destroy them.
He constantly restrained His anger,
    and did not stir up all His wrath;
78.39:
for He remembered that they were but flesh,
    like a wind that passes away and does not return.
78.40:
How often they provoked Him in the wilderness
    and grieved Him in the desert!
78.41:
Yes, they tested God over and over,
    and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
78.42:
They did not remember His power,
    nor the day when He delivered them from the enemy,
78.43:
how He had performed His signs in Egypt
    and His wonders in the fields of Zoan:
78.44:
and He turned their rivers into blood,
    so that they could not drink from their streams.
78.45:
He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them,
    and frogs, which destroyed them.
78.46:
He gave also their crops to the grasshopper
    and the fruit of their labor to the locust.
78.47:
He destroyed their vines with hail
    and their sycamore trees with frost.
78.48:
He gave up their cattle also to the hail
    and their flocks to thunderbolts.
78.49:
He cast upon them the fierceness of His anger,
    wrath, indignation, and trouble,
    by sending angels bringing disaster.
78.51:
And struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
    the first fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.
78.52:
Then He led out His own people like sheep
    and guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
78.53:
He led them in safety, so that they were not afraid,
    but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
78.54:
He brought them to the border of His holy land,
    to the mountain that His right hand had acquired.
78.55:
He cast out the nations also before them,
    and divided for them their tribal allotments,
    and made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
78.56:
Yet they tested and provoked the Most High God,
    and did not keep His commands,
78.57:
but turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers;
    they turned aside like a deceitful bow.
78.58:
For they provoked Him to anger with their high places
    and moved Him to jealousy with their graven images.
78.59:
When God heard this, He was full of wrath
    and greatly rejected Israel
78.60:
so that He left the tabernacle at Shiloh,
    the tent where He lived among people,
78.61:
and delivered His strength to captivity
    and His glory into the enemy’s hand.
78.62:
He gave His people over also to the sword;
    He was enraged with His inheritance.
78.63:
The fire consumed their young men,
    and their maidens were not given to marriage in song.
78.64:
Their priests fell by the sword,
    and their widows made no lamentation.
78.65:
Then the Lord awoke as one out of sleep,
    and like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
78.66:
He routed His enemies back,
    and He made them a perpetual reproach.
78.67:
Moreover, He rejected the tent of Joseph,
    and He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
78.68:
but chose the tribe of Judah,
    Mount Zion which He loves.
78.69:
He built His sanctuary like the high heavens,
    like the earth that He has established perpetually.
78.70:
He chose David His servant
    and took him from the sheepfolds;
78.71:
from following the nursing ewes He brought him
    to shepherd Jacob His people,
    and Israel His inheritance.
78.72:
So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart
    and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

79.2:
The dead bodies of Your servants
    they have given to the birds of the sky for food
    and the flesh of Your faithful to the animals of the land.
79.3:
Their blood they have poured out like water
    all around Jerusalem,
    and there was no one to bury them.
79.4:
We have become a reproach to our neighbors,
    a scorn and derision to those who are around us.
79.5:
How long, O Lord? Will You be angry forever?
    Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
79.6:
Pour out Your wrath
    upon the nations who do not know You,
and upon the kingdoms
    who have not called upon Your name.
79.7:
For they have devoured Jacob,
    and laid waste his dwelling place.
79.9:
Help us, O God of our salvation,
    for the glory of Your name;
deliver us, and purge away our sins,
    for Your name’s sake.
79.10:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where is their God?” 
May the avenging of the shed blood of Your servants
    be known among the nations before our eyes.
79.12:
And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their lap
    the reproach that they have reproached You, O Lord.
79.13:
But we are Your people, the sheep of Your pasture,
    and will give You thanks forever;
we will declare Your praise
    to all generations.

80.2:
In the sight of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh,
stir up Your strength,
    and come and rescue us.
80.3:
Restore us again, O God,
    and cause Your face to shine,
    and we shall be delivered.
80.4:
O Lord God of Hosts,
    how long will You be angry
    against the prayers of Your people?
80.5:
You have fed them with the bread of tears
    and have given them tears to drink in great measure.
80.6:
You make us contention for our neighbors,
    and our enemies laugh among themselves.
80.7:
Restore us again, O God of Hosts,
    and cause Your face to shine,
    and we shall be delivered.
80.8:
You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
    You have cast out the nations and planted it.
80.9:
You cleared the ground for it;
    it took deep root and filled the land.
80.10:
The mountains were covered with its shadow
    and the mighty cedars with its branches.
80.11:
It sent out its branches to the sea
    and its shoots to the River.
80.12:
Why have You then broken down its walls,
    so that all those who pass by the way pluck its fruit?
80.13:
The boar from the woods ravages it,
    and the insects of the field devour it.
80.15:
and the root that Your right hand has planted,
    and the shoots that You made strong for Yourself.
80.16:
It is burned with fire; it is cut down;
    may they perish at the rebuke from Your presence.
80.17:
Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand,
    the son of man whom You made strong for Yourself.
80.18:
So we will not turn back from You;
    give us life, and we will call upon Your name.

81.1:
Sing aloud unto God our strength;
    make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
81.2:
Lift up a melody, and sound the tambourine,
    the pleasant lyre with the harp.
81.3:
Blow the trumpet at the New Moon,
    at the full moon on our feast day.
81.4:
For this is a statute for Israel,
    a decree of the God of Jacob.
81.5:
This He ordained in Joseph as a decree
    when He went out against the land of Egypt. 
I heard a voice that I had not known:
81.6:
“I removed his shoulder from the burden;
    his hands were released from holding the basket.
81.8:
Hear, O My people, and I will testify against you.
    O Israel, if you would listen to me!
81.9:
There shall be no strange god among you;
    neither shall you bow down to any strange god.
81.11:
“But My people would not listen to My voice;
    Israel would not submit to Me.
81.12:
So I gave them up to their stubborn hearts,
    to walk in their own counsels.
81.13:
“Oh, that My people would listen to Me,
    and Israel would follow in My ways!
81.14:
I would soon subdue their enemies,
    and turn My hand against their adversaries.
81.15:
Let those who hate the Lord cower before Him
    and their fate might last forever.
81.16:
But I would feed them with the finest of wheat,
    and with honey out of the rock I would satisfy you.”

82.1:
God stands among the divine council;
    He renders judgment among the gods.
82.2:
“How long will you all judge unjustly
    and accept partiality of the wicked? Selah
82.3:
Defend the poor and fatherless;
    vindicate the afflicted and needy.
82.4:
Grant escape to the abused and the destitute,
    pluck them out of the hand of the false.
82.6:
I have said, “You are gods,
    sons of the Most High, all of you,
82.7:
but you all shall die like men,
    and fall like a man, O princes.”
82.8:
Arise, O God, judge the earth,
    for You shall inherit all nations.

83.1:
Do not keep Your silence, O God;
    do not hold Your peace or be still, O God.
83.2:
For, look, Your enemies make an uproar,
    and those who hate You have lifted up their heads.
83.3:
They have given crafty counsel against Your people,
    and have consulted against Your treasured ones.
83.4:
They have said, “Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation,
    that the name of Israel may be no more remembered.”
83.5:
For they have conspired together;
    they make a covenant against You—
83.6:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
    even Moab and the Hagrites;
83.7:
Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
    the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
83.8:
Assyria also is joined with them,
    they are the strength of the descendants of Lot. Selah
83.9:
Do to them as You did to the Midianites,
    as to Sisera and Jabin at the river of Kishon,
83.10:
who perished at Endor;
    they became as dung for the ground.
83.11:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb;
    yes, all their princes as Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12:
who said, “Let us take for ourselves
    the pastures of God as a possession.”
83.13:
O my God, make them like a tumbleweed,
    as stubble before the wind.
83.14:
As fire burns a forest,
    and as the flame sets the mountains ablaze,
83.15:
so pursue them with Your storm,
    and make them afraid with Your hurricane.
83.16:
Fill their faces with shame,
    that they may seek your name, O Lord.
83.17:
Let them be confounded and troubled forever;
    yes, let them be put to shame and perish,
83.18:
that they may know that You, whose name alone is the Lord,
    are the Most High over all the earth.

84.1:
How lovely is Your dwelling place,
    O Lord of Hosts!
84.2:
My soul longs, yes, even faints
    for the courts of the Lord;
my heart and my body cry out
    for the living God.
84.3:
Yes, the sparrow has found a home
    and the swallow a nest for herself,
    where she may lay her young,
even at Your altars,
    O Lord of Hosts, my King and my God.
84.4:
Blessed are those who dwell in Your house;
    they continually praise You. Selah
84.5:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in You,
    in whose heart are the paths to Zion.
84.7:
They go from strength to strength;
    every one of them appears in Zion before God.
84.8:
O Lord God of Hosts, hear my prayer,
    and give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah
84.9:
Behold, O God our shield,
    and look upon the face of Your anointed.
84.10:
For a day in Your courts is better
    than a thousand elsewhere.
I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God
    than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
84.11:
For the Lord God is a sun and shield;
    the Lord will give favor and glory,
for no good thing will He withhold
    from the one who walks uprightly.
84.12:
O Lord of Hosts,
    blessed is the man who trusts in You.

85.1:
Lord, You have been favorable to Your land;
    You have brought back the captivity of Jacob.
85.2:
You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people;
    You have covered all their sin. Selah
85.3:
You have withdrawn all Your wrath;
    You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
85.4:
Restore us, O God of our salvation,
    and put away Your indignation toward us.
85.5:
Will You be angry with us forever?
    Will You draw out Your anger to all generations?
85.6:
Will You not revive us again,
    that Your people may rejoice in You?
85.7:
Show us Your mercy, O Lord,
    and grant us Your deliverance.
85.9:
Surely His salvation is near to them who fear Him,
    that glory may dwell in our land.
85.10:
Mercy and truth have met together;
    righteousness and peace have kissed.
85.11:
Truth springs from the ground,
    and righteousness looks down from the sky.
85.12:
Yes, the Lord gives that which is good,
    and our land shall yield its increase.
85.13:
Righteousness shall go before Him
    and prepare a way for His footsteps.

86.1:
Incline Your ear, O Lord, and answer me,
    for I am oppressed and needy.
86.3:
Have mercy on me, O Lord,
    for to You I cry all day long.
86.5:
For You, Lord, are good, and forgiving,
    abounding in kindness to all who call on You.
86.6:
Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer,
    and attend to my plea for mercy.
86.7:
In the day of my trouble I will call upon You,
    for You will answer me.
86.8:
Among the gods there is none like You, O Lord;
    neither are there any works like Your works.
86.9:
All nations whom You have made
    shall come and worship before You, O Lord,
    and shall glorify Your name.
86.10:
For You are great and do wondrous deeds;
    You are God alone.
86.11:
Teach me Your way, O Lord,
    that I will walk in Your truth;
bind my heart
    to fear Your name.
86.12:
I will give You thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
    and I will glorify Your name forever.
86.13:
For great is Your mercy toward me,
    and You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
86.15:
But You, O Lord, are a God full of compassion and gracious,
    slow to anger, and abundant in mercy and truth.
86.17:
Show me a sign of Your favor,
    that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed
    because You, Lord, have helped and comforted me.

87.1: The city of His foundation is on the holy mountain.
87.2:
The Lord loves the gates of Zion
    more than all the dwelling places of Jacob.
87.3:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
    O city of God. Selah.
87.5:
But of Zion it shall be said,
    “This one and that one were born in her,”
    for the Most High shall make her secure.
87.6:
The Lord shall count when He registers the people,
    “This one was born there.” Selah
87.7:
As well the singers and the players of instruments say,
    “All my springs are in you.”

88.1:
O Lord, God of my salvation,
    I cry out day and night before You.
88.2:
Let my prayer come before You;
    incline Your ear to my cry.
88.3:
For my soul is full of troubles,
    and my life draws near to Sheol.
88.4:
I am counted with those who go down to the grave;
    I am a man who has no strength,
88.5:
like one who is set free among the dead,
    like the slain who lie in the grave,
like those whom You remember no more,
    for they are cut off from Your hand.
88.6:
You have laid me in the depths of the pit,
    in dark and deep regions.
88.7:
Your wrath lies heavy upon me,
    and You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah
88.9:
my eye is dim from my affliction. 
Lord, I call daily upon You,
    and I have stretched out my hands to You.
88.10:
Will You show wonders to the dead?
    Shall the dead rise up to praise You? Selah
88.11:
Shall Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave,
    or your faithfulness in Abaddon?
88.12:
Shall Your wonders be known in the darkness
    or Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
88.13:
But unto You have I cried, O Lord,
    and in the morning my prayer comes before You.
88.14:
O Lord, why do You cast away my soul?
    Why do You hide Your face from me?
88.15:
I am afflicted and close to death since my youth;
    while I suffer Your terrors I am helpless.
88.16:
Your fierce wrath sweeps over me;
    Your terrors destroy me.
88.17:
They come around me daily like a flood;
    they encircle me together.
88.18:
You have caused to be far from me my lovers and friends,
    and my companion is darkness.

89.1:
I will sing of the mercies of the Lord forever;
    with my mouth I will make known Your faithfulness to all generations.
89.2:
For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up forever;
    Your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.”
89.3:
You have said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
    I have sworn to David my servant:
89.4:
‘Your offspring I will establish forever,
    and build up your throne for all generations.’ ” Selah
89.5:
Let the heavens praise Your wonders, O Lord;
    Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
89.6:
For who in the skies can be compared to the Lord?
    Who among the heavenly sons is like the Lord?
89.7:
God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the holy ones
    and awesome to all those who surround Him.
89.8:
O Lord God of Hosts, who is a mighty Lord like You,
    with Your faithfulness all around You?
89.9:
You rule the raging of the sea;
    when the waves arise, You still them.
89.10:
You crushed Rahab like a corpse;
    You scattered Your enemies with Your strong arm.
89.11:
The heavens are Yours; the earth also is Yours;
    the world and all that is in it, You have founded them.
89.12:
The north and the south, You have created them;
    Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Your name.
89.13:
You have a mighty arm,
    and strong is Your hand, and victorious is Your right hand.
89.14:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne;
    mercy and truth shall go before Your presence.
89.15:
Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout.
    They walk, O Lord, in the light of Your presence.
89.16:
In Your name they rejoice all the day,
    and in Your righteousness they shall be exalted.
89.17:
For You are the beauty of their strength;
    by Your favor our horn is exalted.
89.18:
For the Lord is our shield of defense,
    and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
89.19:
Long ago You spoke in a vision
    to Your godly one and said:
“I have given help to one who is mighty;
    I have exalted one chosen from the people.
89.20:
I have found David, My servant;
    with My holy oil I have anointed him:
89.21:
By whom My hand shall be established;
    My arm also shall strengthen him.
89.22:
The enemy shall not take tribute from him,
    nor the wicked humiliate him.
89.23:
I will beat down his foes before him
    and strike down those who hate him.
89.24:
My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him,
    and in My name his horn shall be exalted.
89.25:
I will set his hand on the sea
    and his right hand on the rivers.
89.26:
He shall cry unto Me, ‘You are my Father, my God,
    and the Rock of my salvation.’
89.27:
Also I will make him my firstborn,
    the highest of the kings of the earth.
89.28:
In My mercy I will keep him forever,
    and My covenant shall stand firm with him.
89.29:
His offspring also I will establish forever
    and his throne as the days of heaven.
89.30:
“If his children forsake My law
    and do not walk in My judgments,
89.31:
if they break My statutes
    and do not keep My commandments,
89.32:
then I will punish their transgression with the rod
    and their iniquity with lashes.
89.33:
Nevertheless My lovingkindness I will not remove from him
    nor be false in My faithfulness.
89.34:
My covenant I will not violate
    nor alter the word that has gone out from My lips.
89.35:
Once and for all I have sworn by My holiness
    that I will not lie to David:
89.36:
His offspring shall endure forever,
    and his throne as the sun before Me;
89.37:
it shall be established forever as the moon
    and as a faithful witness in the heavens.” Selah
89.38:
But now You have cast off and rejected him,
    You have been wrathful with Your anointed king.
89.39:
You have renounced the covenant with Your servant;
    You have defiled his crown by casting it to the ground.
89.40:
You have broken down all his walls;
    You have brought his strongholds to ruin.
89.41:
All who pass by the way plunder him;
    he is a reproach to his neighbors.
89.42:
You have set high the right hand of his adversaries;
    You have made all his enemies rejoice.
89.43:
You have also turned back the edge of his sword
    and have not made him stand in battle.
89.44:
You have made his glory cease
    and cast his throne down to the ground.
89.45:
The days of his youth You have shortened;
    You have covered him with shame. Selah
89.46:
How long, O Lord? Will You hide Yourself forever?
    How long shall Your wrath burn like fire?
89.47:
Remember how short my time is!
    Why have You made all people in such emptiness?
89.48:
What man can live and not see death?
    Who can deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah
89.49:
Lord, where are Your former lovingkindnesses,
    which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
89.50:
Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants
    and how I bear in my heart the insults of the many nations,
89.51:
which Your enemies taunt, O Lord,
    with which they mock the footsteps of Your anointed king.
89.52:
Blessed be the Lord forever!
Amen and Amen.

90.1:
Lord, You have been our dwelling place
    in all generations.
90.2:
Before the mountains were brought forth,
    or You had formed the earth and the world,
    even from everlasting to everlasting You are God.
90.3:
You return man to the dust
    and say, “Return, you children of men.”
90.4:
For a thousand years in Your sight
    are but as yesterday when it is past,
    or as a night watch in the night time.
90.5:
You carry them away as with a flood;
    they are as a dream, like renewed grass in the morning:
90.6:
In the morning it flourishes and grows up;
    in the evening it fades and withers.
90.7:
For we are consumed by Your anger,
    and by Your wrath we are terrified.
90.8:
You have set our iniquities before You,
    even our secret sins in the light of Your presence.
90.9:
For all our days pass away in your wrath;
    we end our years with a groan.
90.10:
The years of our life are seventy,
    and if by reason of strength eighty;
yet their length is toil and sorrow,
    for they soon end, and we fly away.
90.11:
Who knows the power of Your anger?
    Or Your wrath according to Your fear?
90.12:
So teach us to number our days,
    that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.
90.13:
Return, O Lord, how long?
    Have mercy on Your servants.
90.14:
Satisfy us in the early morning with Your mercy,
    that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
90.15:
Make us glad according to the days that You have afflicted us,
    and the years that we have seen evil.
90.16:
Let Your work be displayed to Your servants
    and Your glory to their children.

91.1:
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High
    shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
91.2:
I will say of the Lord, “He is my refuge and my fortress,
    my God in whom I trust.”
91.3:
Surely He shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter
    and from the deadly pestilence.
91.5:
You shall not be afraid of the terror by night,
    nor of the arrow that flies by day;
91.6:
nor of the pestilence that pursues in darkness,
    nor of the destruction that strikes at noonday.
91.7:
A thousand may fall at your side
    and ten thousand at your right hand,
    but it shall not come near you.
91.8:
Only with your eyes shall you behold
    and see the reward of the wicked.
91.9:
Because you have made the Lord, who is my refuge,
    even the Most High, your dwelling,
91.10:
there shall be no evil befall you,
    neither shall any plague come near your tent;
91.11:
for He shall give His angels charge over you
    to guard you in all your ways.
91.12:
They shall bear you up in their hands,
    lest you strike your foot against a stone.
91.13:
You shall tread upon the lion and adder;
    the young lion and the serpent you shall trample underfoot.
91.14:
Because he has set his love upon Me, therefore I will deliver him;
    I will set him on high, because he has known My name.
91.16:
With long life I will satisfy him
    and show him My salvation.

92.1:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord,
    and to sing praises unto Your name, O Most High:
92.2:
to declare forth Your lovingkindness in the morning
    and Your faithfulness in the night,
92.3:
on a ten-stringed lute and on the harp,
    and on the lyre with a solemn sound.
92.4:
For you, O Lord, have made me glad through Your work;
    I will sing joyfully at the works of Your hands.
92.5:
O Lord, how great are Your works!
    Your thoughts are very deep!
92.6:
A brutish man does not recognize,
    neither does the fool understand this.
92.7:
Though the wicked spring up as the grass
    and all those who do iniquity flourish,
they shall be destroyed forever:
92.8: But You, O Lord, are on high forever.
92.10:
But my horn You have exalted like the horn of the wild ox;
    You have anointed me with fresh oil.
92.11:
My eyes also shall see the downfall of my enemies,
    and my ears shall hear the doom of my wicked adversaries.
92.12:
The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree
    and grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
92.13:
Those that are planted in the house of the Lord
    shall flourish in the courts of our God.
92.14:
They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;
    they shall be filled with vitality and foliage,
92.15:
to show that the Lord is upright;
    He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

93.2:
Your throne is established of old;
    You are from everlasting.
93.4:
The Lord on high is mightier than the noise of many waters,
    yes, than the mighty waves of the sea.

94.1:
O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongs;
    O God to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth.
94.2:
Rise up, O Judge of the earth;
    render to the proud what they deserve.
94.3:
O Lord, how long shall the wicked,
    how long shall the wicked triumph?
94.4:
They spew forth their arrogant words;
    all those who do iniquity boast.
94.5:
They break in pieces Your people, O Lord,
    and afflict Your inheritance.
94.6:
They kill the widow and the sojourner,
    and murder the fatherless.
94.7:
Yet they say, “The Lord does not see,
    neither does the God of Jacob regard it.”
94.8:
Understand, you brutish among the people;
    fools, when will you be wise?
94.9:
He who made the ear, shall He not hear?
    He who formed the eye, shall He not see?
94.10:
He who chastises the nations, shall He not correct?
    He teaches people knowledge!
94.11:
The Lord, He knows the thoughts of people,
    that they are a breath.
94.12:
Blessed is the man whom You chasten, O Lord,
    and teach from Your law,
94.13:
that You may give him rest from the days of adversity,
    until a pit is dug for the wicked.
94.14:
For the Lord will not forsake His people;
    neither will He abandon His inheritance.
94.15:
But justice shall return to those who are righteous,
    and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
94.16:
Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
    Who will stand up for me against those who do iniquity?
94.17:
Unless the Lord had been my help,
    my soul would have lived in the land of silent death.
94.18:
When I said, “My foot slips,”
    Your mercy, O Lord, held me up.
94.19:
When there is a multitude of worries within me,
    Your comforts delight my soul.
94.20:
Shall wicked rulers, who make oppressive laws,
    align with You?
94.21:
They conspire together against the life of the righteous
    and condemn innocent blood to death.
94.22:
But the Lord is my defense,
    and my God is the rock of my refuge.

95.1:
O come, let us sing unto the Lord;
    let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation!
95.2:
Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving;
    let us make a joyful noise unto Him with psalms!
95.3:
For the Lord is a great God,
    and a great King above all gods.
95.4:
In His hand are the deep places of the earth;
    the heights of the mountains are also His.
95.5:
The sea is His, for He made it,
    and His hands formed the dry land.
95.6:
O come, let us worship and bow down;
    let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker.
95.7:
For He is our God,
    and we are the people of His pasture
    and the sheep of His hand. 
Today if you hear His voice,
95.8:
do not harden your hearts, as at Meribah,
    and as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
95.9:
when your fathers tested Me and tried Me,
    though they had seen My deeds.
95.10:
For forty years I loathed that generation
    and said, “They are a people who go astray in their heart,
    and they have not known My ways.”
95.11:
Therefore I swore in My wrath,
    “They shall not enter into My rest.”

96.1:
O sing unto the Lord a new song;
    sing unto the Lord, all the earth!
96.2:
Sing unto the Lord, bless His name;
    declare His salvation from day to day.
96.3:
Proclaim His glory among the nations,
    His wonders among all peoples.
96.4:
For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised;
    He is to be feared above all gods.
96.5:
For all the gods of the nations are worthless,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
96.6:
Honor and majesty are before Him;
    strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
96.7:
Give unto the Lord, O families of the people,
    give unto the Lord glory and strength.
96.8:
Give unto the Lord the glory due His name;
    bring an offering, and come into His courts.
96.9:
Worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness;
    tremble before Him, all the earth.
96.11:
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
    let the sea roar, and all that fills it;
96.12:
let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
then all the trees of the forests shall rejoice
96.13:
before the Lord, for He comes,
    for He comes to judge the earth.
He shall judge the world with righteousness
    and the peoples with His faithfulness.

97.1:
The Lord reigns; let the earth rejoice;
    let the many coastlands be glad!
97.2:
Clouds and darkness are all around Him;
    righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
97.3:
A fire goes before Him
    and burns up His enemies all around.
97.4:
His lightning bolts light up the world;
    the earth sees and shakes.
97.5:
The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the Lord of the earth.
97.6:
The heavens declare His righteousness,
    and all the peoples see His glory.
97.8:
Zion hears and is glad,
    and the daughters of Judah rejoice
    because of Your judgments, O Lord.
97.9:
For You, O Lord, are Most High above all the earth;
    You are exalted far above all gods.
97.11:
Light goes out for the righteous,
    and gladness for the upright in heart.
97.12:
Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous,
    and give thanks at the memory of His holy name.

98.1:
Oh, sing to the Lord a new song,
    for He has done marvelous deeds!
His right hand and His holy arm
    have accomplished deliverance.
98.2:
The Lord has made known His salvation;
    His righteousness He has revealed in the sight of the nations.
98.3:
He has remembered His mercy
    and His faithfulness toward the house of Israel;
all the ends of the earth have seen
    the deliverance of our God.
98.4:
Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth;
    break out in loud songs, and sing praises.
98.5:
Sing unto the Lord with the harp,
    with the harp and the sound of melody,
98.6:
with trumpets and sound of the horn;
    make a joyful noise before the Lord, the King.
98.7:
Let the sea roar, and all that fills it,
    the world and those who live in it;
98.8:
let the rivers clap their hands;
    let the hills be joyful together
98.9:
before the Lord,
    for He is coming to judge the earth.
With righteousness He will judge the world,
    and the peoples with justice.

99.2:
The Lord is great in Zion;
    He is high above all the peoples.
99.3:
Let them praise Your great and awesome name—
    He is holy!
99.4:
The King’s strength loves justice;
    You establish righteousness,
and You execute judgment
    and fairness in Jacob.
99.5:
Exalt the Lord our God,
    and worship at His footstool—
    He is holy!
99.6:
Moses and Aaron were among His priests,
    even Samuel was among them who called upon His name;
they called upon the Lord,
    and He answered them.
99.7:
He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud;
    they kept His statues and the ordinance that He gave them.
99.8:
You answered them,
    O Lord our God;
You were a God who forgave them,
    though You took vengeance on their wrongdoing.

100.1: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all the earth!
100.2:
Serve the Lord with gladness;
    come before His presence with singing.
100.5:
For the Lord is good; His mercy endures forever,
    and His faithfulness to all generations.

101.1:
I will sing of mercy and justice;
    to You, O Lord, I will sing.
101.2:
I will consider the path that is blameless.
    When will You come to me? 
I will walk within my house
    with a perfect heart.
101.3:
I will set no wicked thing
    before my eyes. 
I hate the work of those who turn aside;
    it shall not have part of me.
101.4:
A perverted heart shall be far from me;
    I will not know anything wicked.
101.5:
Whoever privately slanders his neighbor,
    him I will destroy;
whoever has a haughty look and a proud heart
    I will not endure.
101.6:
My eyes shall be favorable to the faithful in the land,
    that they may live with me;
he who walks in a blameless manner,
    he shall serve me.
101.7:
He who practices deceit
    shall not dwell within my house;
he who tells lies
    shall not remain in my sight.
101.8:
Every morning I will destroy
    all the wicked in the land,
that I may cut off all wicked doers
    from the city of the Lord.

102.1:
Hear my prayer, O Lord,
    and let my cry come unto You.
102.3:
For my days are consumed like smoke,
    and my bones are burned as a furnace.
102.4:
My heart is struck down and withered like grass,
    so that I forget to eat my bread.
102.5:
Because of the sound of my groaning
    my bones cling to my skin.
102.6:
I am like an owl of the wilderness,
    like a screech owl of the desert.
102.7:
I stay awake and am
    as a sparrow alone upon the housetop.
102.8:
My enemies reproach me all the day,
    and those who taunt me curse my name.
102.9:
For I have eaten ashes like bread
    and mixed my drink with weeping,
102.10:
because of Your indignation and Your wrath,
    for You have lifted me up, and cast me down.
102.11:
My days are like an evening shadow that vanishes,
    and I wither away like grass.
102.12:
But You, O Lord, shall endure forever enthroned
    and Your reputation to all generations.
102.14:
For Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
    and have pity on her dust.
102.15:
So the nations shall fear the name of the Lord,
    and all the kings of the earth Your glory.
102.16:
For the Lord shall build up Zion;
    He shall appear in His glory.
102.17:
He will regard the prayer of the destitute
    and will not despise their prayer.
102.18:
Let this be written for the generation to come,
    that a people who shall be created shall praise the Lord.
102.19:
For He has looked down from the height of His sanctuary;
    from heaven the Lord looked down on the earth,
102.20:
to hear the groaning of the prisoners
    and to set free those who are appointed to death,
102.21:
that they may declare the name of the Lord in Zion
    and His praise in Jerusalem;
102.22:
when the peoples are gathered together,
    and the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.
102.23:
He has weakened my strength in my midlife;
    He has shortened my days.
102.24:
I said,
    “O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days—
    Your years endure throughout all generations.”
102.25:
From before You have laid the foundation of the earth,
    and the heavens are the work of Your hands.
102.27:
but You are the same,
    and Your years shall have no end.
102.28:
The children of Your servants shall be secure,
    and their offspring shall be established before You.

103.1:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
    and all that is within me, bless His holy name.
103.2:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
    and forget not all His benefits,
103.3:
who forgives all your iniquities,
    who heals all your diseases,
103.4:
who redeems your life from the pit,
    who crowns you with lovingkindness and tender mercies,
103.5:
who satisfies your mouth with good things,
    so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
103.6:
The Lord does righteousness
    and justice for all who are oppressed.
103.7:
He made known His ways to Moses,
    His acts to the people of Israel.
103.8:
The Lord is merciful and gracious,
    slow to anger, and abounding in mercy.
103.9:
He will not always accuse,
    neither will He keep his anger forever.
103.10:
He does not treat us according to our sins,
    nor repay us according to our iniquities.
103.11:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
    so great is His mercy toward those who fear Him;
103.12:
as far as the east is from the west,
    so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
103.13:
Like a father shows compassion to his children,
    so the Lord gives compassion to those who fear Him.
103.14:
For He knows how we are formed;
    He remembers that we are dust.
103.15:
As for man, his days are as grass;
    as a flower of the field he flourishes.
103.16:
For the hot wind passes over it, and it is gone;
    the place where it was is not known.
103.17:
But the mercy of the Lord
    is from everlasting to everlasting
upon those who fear Him,
    and His righteousness to children’s children,
103.18:
to those who keep His covenant,
    and to those who remember to do His commandments.
103.19:
The Lord has established His throne in the heavens,
    and His kingdom rules over all.
103.20:
Bless the Lord, you His angels,
    who are mighty, and do His commands,
    and obey the voice of His word.
103.21:
Bless the Lord, all you His hosts;
    you servants who do His pleasure.
103.22:
Bless the Lord, all His works,
    in all places of His dominion. 
Bless the Lord, O my soul!

104.1:
Bless the Lord, O my soul! 
O Lord my God, You are very great!
    You are clothed with honor and majesty,
104.2:
covering Yourself with light as a garment,
    who stretches out the heavens like a tent curtain,
104.3:
who lays the upper beams of His chambers on the waters above,
who makes the clouds His chariot,
    who rides upon the wings of the wind,
104.4:
who makes His angels as winds,
    His ministers a flaming fire.
104.5:
You laid the earth on its foundations,
    so that it should never be moved.
104.6:
You covered it with the deep as a garment;
    the waters stood above the mountains.
104.7:
At Your rebuke they fled;
    at the sound of Your thunder they departed away.
104.9:
You set a boundary that they may not pass over,
    that they may not again cover the earth.
104.10:
You send the springs to gush forth in the valleys,
    which flow between the hills.
104.11:
They give drink to every animal of the field;
    the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12:
By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation;
    they sing among the branches.
104.13:
You water the mountains from Your lofty chamber;
    the earth is satisfied with the fruit of Your works.
104.14:
You cause the grass to grow for the cattle
    and plants for the cultivation of man,
    that he may bring forth food from the earth
104.15:
and wine that makes glad the heart of man,
    and oil that makes shine his face,
    and bread that strengthens his heart.
104.16:
The trees of the Lord are well watered,
    the cedars of Lebanon that He has planted,
104.17:
where the birds make their nests,
    where the stork has its home in the fir trees.
104.18:
The high mountains are for the wild goats,
    and the rocks a refuge for the badgers.
104.19:
He set the moon to mark the appointed seasons;
    the sun knows its time for going down.
104.20:
You make darkness, and it is night,
    when all the animals of the forest go forth.
104.21:
The young lions roar after their prey
    and seek their food from God.
104.22:
When the sun arises, they gather themselves together
    and lay down in their dens.
104.23:
Man goes forth to his work
    and to his labor until the evening.
104.25:
so is this great and wide sea,
    which is full of innumerable creatures,
    living animals both small and great.
104.26:
There go the ships,
    and there is Leviathan, which You have made to play in it.
104.27:
These all wait upon You,
    that You may give them their food in due season.
104.28:
When You give it to them,
    they gather it;
when You open Your hand,
    they are filled with good food.
104.29:
When You hide Your face,
    they are troubled;
You take away their breath,
    and they die and return to their dust.
104.30:
When You send forth Your Spirit,
    they are created,
    and You renew the surface of the ground.
104.31:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
    may the Lord rejoice in His works.
104.32:
He looks on the earth, and it trembles;
    He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33:
I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live;
    I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
104.34:
May my meditation be sweet to Him,
    for I will be glad in the Lord.
104.35:
Let sinners be consumed from the earth,
    and let the wicked be no more. 
Bless the Lord, O my soul! 
Praise the Lord!

105.1:
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord; call upon His name;
    make known His deeds among the peoples.
105.2:
Sing unto Him, sing praises unto Him;
    proclaim all His wondrous works.
105.3:
Glory in His holy name;
    let the heart rejoice for those who seek the Lord.
105.4:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
    seek His presence continuously.
105.5:
Remember His marvelous works that He has done;
    His wonders and the judgments from His mouth,
105.6:
O offspring of Abraham, His servant,
    O children of Jacob, His chosen ones.
105.7:
He is the Lord our God;
    His judgments are in all the earth.
105.8:
He remembers His covenant forever,
    the word that He commanded, to a thousand generations,
105.9:
that covenant He made with Abraham,
    and His oath to Isaac,
105.10:
and confirmed to Jacob as a decree,
    and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
105.11:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as the portion of your inheritance.”
105.12:
When they were but a few people in number,
    indeed, very few, and strangers in it,
105.13:
when they went from one nation to another,
    from one kingdom to another people,
105.14:
He did not permit anyone to do them wrong;
    indeed, He reproved kings on their behalf,
105.15:
saying, “Do not touch my anointed ones,
    and do no harm to my prophets.”
105.16:
Moreover He called for a famine upon the land;
    He broke the whole supply of bread.
105.17:
He sent a man before them,
    Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.18:
They hurt his feet with fetters;
    his neck was put in an iron collar.
105.19:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
    the word of the Lord tested him.
105.20:
The king sent and released him;
    the ruler of the people let him go free.
105.21:
He made Joseph lord of his house
    and ruler of all his possessions,
105.22:
to imprison his princes at Joseph’s pleasure
    and to teach his elders wisdom.
105.23:
Then Israel came into Egypt,
    and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
105.24:
The Lord increased His people greatly
    and made them stronger than their enemies.
105.25:
He turned their hearts to hate His people,
    to deal cleverly with His servants.
105.26:
He sent Moses, His servant,
    and Aaron whom He had chosen.
105.27:
They showed His signs among them
    and wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28:
He sent darkness and made the land dark,
    and Moses and Aaron did not rebel against His word.
105.29:
He turned their waters into blood
    and caused their fish to die.
105.30:
Their land brought forth frogs in abundance,
    even in the chambers of their kings.
105.31:
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies
    and gnats in all their country.
105.32:
He gave them hail for rain
    and flaming lightning in their land.
105.33:
He struck their vines and their fig trees
    and shattered the trees of their country.
105.34:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
    and caterpillars without number,
105.35:
that devoured all the vegetation in their land,
    and ate all the fruit of their ground.
105.36:
He struck down all the firstborn in their land,
    the first fruits of all their strength.
105.37:
Then He brought them out with silver and gold,
    and no one among their tribes faltered.
105.38:
Egypt was glad when they left,
    for the fear of Israel fell upon them.
105.39:
He spread a cloud for a covering,
    and fire to give light in the night.
105.40:
The people asked, and He brought quail,
    and satisfied them with abundant bread of heaven.
105.41:
He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out;
    they ran in the desert like a river.
105.42:
For he recalled His holy promise
    to Abraham His servant.
105.43:
He brought forth His people with joy,
    and His chosen ones with gladness,
105.44:
and gave them the lands of the nations,
    and they took possession of the fruitful labor of the people,
105.45:
that they might observe His statutes
    and keep His laws. 
Praise the Lord!

106.1:
Praise the Lord! 
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good,
    for His mercy endures forever.
106.2:
Who can recount the mighty acts of the Lord
    or declare all His praise?
106.3:
Blessed are those who keep justice
    and who do righteousness at all times.
106.4:
Remember me, O Lord, when You give favor to Your people;
    visit me with Your deliverance,
106.5:
that I may see the goodness over Your chosen ones,
    that I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation,
    that I may glory with Your inheritance.
106.6:
We have sinned with our fathers;
    we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedly.
106.7:
Our fathers did not consider
    Your wonders in Egypt;
they did not remember the greatness of Your mercy,
    but rebelled against Him at the sea, by the Red Sea.
106.8:
Nevertheless He saved them for His name’s sake,
    that He might make His mighty power known.
106.9:
He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up,
    so He led them through the depths as through the wilderness.
106.10:
He saved them from the hand of him who hated them
    and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11:
The waters covered their enemies;
    there was not one of them left.
106.12:
Then they believed His words;
    they sang His praise.
106.13:
But they soon forgot His works;
    they did not wait for His counsel,
106.14:
but they lusted exceedingly in the wilderness
    and tested God in the desert.
106.15:
He gave them their request,
    but He sent a wasting disease on them.
106.16:
They envied in the camp Moses
    and Aaron, the holy priest of the Lord.
106.17:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
    and engulfed those led by Abiram.
106.18:
A fire broke out among their company;
    the flame burned up the wicked.
106.19:
They made a calf at Horeb,
    and worshipped the molded image.
106.20:
Thus they changed the glory of God
    for the image of an ox that eats grass.
106.21:
They forgot God, their Deliverer,
    who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22:
wondrous works in the land of Ham,
    and marvelous deeds by the Red Sea.
106.23:
Therefore He said that He would destroy them,
    had not Moses, His chosen one,
stood before Him to intercede,
    to turn away His wrath from destroying them.
106.24:
Then they despised the pleasant land;
    they did not believe His promise,
106.25:
but they grumbled in their tents,
    and did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106.26:
Therefore He lifted up His hand against them
    and swore to overthrow them in the wilderness,
106.27:
and to overthrow their offspring among the nations,
    and to scatter them in the lands.
106.28:
They joined themselves to Baal of Peor
    and ate the sacrifices given for the dead.
106.29:
Thus they provoked Him to anger with their acts,
    and a plague broke out upon them.
106.30:
Then Phinehas stood up and interceded,
    and so the plague ceased.
106.31:
That was counted unto him for righteousness
    unto all generations forever.
106.32:
They angered Him also at the waters of Meribah,
    so that Moses suffered because of them,
106.33:
because they provoked his temper,
    so that he spoke impulsively with his lips.
106.34:
They did not destroy the nations
    as the Lord commanded them,
106.35:
but they mixed among the nations
    and learned their deeds;
106.36:
they served their idols,
    which were a snare to them.
106.37:
Yes, they sacrificed their sons
    and their daughters to demons,
106.38:
and poured out innocent blood,
    even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
    and the land was polluted with blood.
106.39:
Thus were they defiled by their acts
    and acted like whores with these actions.
106.40:
Therefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against His people,
    and He abhorred His own inheritance.
106.41:
He gave them into the hand of the nations,
    and those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42:
Their enemies also oppressed them,
    and Israel was brought into subjection under their powerful hand.
106.43:
Many times He delivered them,
    but they were rebellious against Him with their counsel,
    and were afflicted for their iniquity.
106.44:
Nevertheless, He regarded their affliction,
    when He heard their cry:
106.45:
and He remembered on their behalf His covenant
    and relented according to the greatness of His mercies.
106.46:
He made them pitied
    among all those who held them captive.
106.47:
Save us, O Lord our God,
    and gather us from among the nations,
to give thanks unto Your holy name
    and to boast in Your praise.
106.48:
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting,
and let all the people say, “Amen!” 
Praise the Lord!

107.1:
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good,
    for His mercy endures forever!
107.2:
Let the redeemed of the Lord speak out,
    whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy,
107.3:
and gathered them from the lands,
    from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
107.4:
They wandered in the wilderness on a deserted path;
    they found no city to dwell in.
107.5:
Hungry and thirsty,
    their soul fainted in them.
107.6:
Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
    and He delivered them out of their distresses.
107.7:
He led them on a level road,
    that they might go to a city to live in.
107.8:
Let them praise the Lord for His goodness
    and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.9:
For He satisfies the longing soul
    and fills the hungry soul with goodness.
107.10:
Some sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    being prisoners in affliction and irons,
107.11:
because they rebelled against the words of God
    and rejected the counsel of the Most High.
107.12:
Therefore He brought down their hearts with hard labor;
    they fell down, and there was none to help.
107.13:
Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
    and He delivered them out of their distress.
107.14:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
    and broke apart their bonds.
107.15:
Let them praise the Lord for His goodness
    and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.16:
For He has broken the gates of bronze
    and cut the bars of iron in two.
107.17:
Some were fools because of their transgressions,
    and because of their iniquities they are afflicted.
107.18:
They loathed all manner of food,
    and they drew near to the gates of death.
107.19:
Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble,
    and He saved them out of their distress.
107.20:
He sent His word and healed them
    and delivered them from their destruction.
107.21:
Let them praise the Lord for His goodness
    and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.22:
And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving
    and declare His works with rejoicing.
107.23:
Some went down to the sea in ships,
    to do business in the vast waters;
107.24:
they saw the works of the Lord
    and His wonders in the deep water.
107.25:
For He commands and raises the stormy wind,
    which lifts up the sea waves.
107.26:
The sailors went up to the sky, they came down to the depths;
    their strength melted because of the great danger.
107.27:
They reeled to and fro and staggered like drunken men,
    and were completely confused.
107.28:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble,
    and He saved them out of their distress.
107.29:
He made the storm calm,
    and the sea waves were still.
107.30:
They were glad because the waters were quiet,
    so He brought them to their desired harbor.
107.31:
Let them praise the Lord for His goodness
    and for His wonderful works to the people!
107.32:
Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people,
    and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
107.33:
He turns rivers into a desert,
    water springs into dry ground,
107.34:
a fruitful land into salty wasteland,
    because of the wickedness of those living there.
107.35:
He turns a wilderness into pools of water,
    a parched ground into springs of water.
107.36:
There He makes the hungry dwell,
    and they prepare a city to live in;
107.37:
they sow fields and plant vineyards,
    and yield a fruitful harvest.
107.38:
He blesses them, so that they are greatly multiplied,
    and He does not let their livestock decrease.
107.39:
But when they are diminished and brought down
    through oppression, affliction, and sorrow,
107.40:
He pours contempt upon princes,
    and causes them to wander in a wilderness with no road;
107.41:
yet He raises up the poor from affliction
    and cares for their families like flocks of sheep.
107.42:
The righteous shall see it and rejoice,
    and all evil people shall stop their mouth.
107.43:
Whoever is wise let him observe these things;
    let them consider the lovingkindness of the Lord.

108.1:
O God, my heart is determined;
    I will sing and give praise with my whole heart.
108.2:
Awake, O lyre and harp!
    I will awake at dawn!
108.3:
I will praise you, O Lord, among the peoples,
    and I will sing praises unto You among the nations.
108.4:
For Your mercy is great above the heavens;
    Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
108.5:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,
    may Your glory be above all the earth.
108.6:
That Your beloved ones may be delivered,
    provide salvation with Your right hand and answer me.
108.7:
God has spoken in His sanctuary:
    “I will triumph and will divide up Shechem
    and portion out the Valley of Sukkoth.
108.10:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
    Who will lead me into Edom?
108.11:
Have You not rejected us, O God?
    You surely do not go out, O God, with our armies.
108.12:
Grant us help against the foe,
    for the help of man is worthless.
108.13:
Through God we shall be valiant,
    for He shall tread down our enemies.

109.1:
Do not remain silent,
    O God of my praise!
109.3:
They encircled me with words of hatred
    and fought against me without cause.
109.4:
In return for my love they are my adversaries,
    but I give myself to prayer.
109.5:
They have rewarded me evil for good
    and hatred for my love.
109.6:
Set a wicked man against him,
    and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.7:
When he shall be judged, let him be condemned,
    and let his prayer be reckoned as sin.
109.8:
Let his days be few,
    and let another take his office.
109.9:
Let his children be fatherless
    and his wife a widow.
109.10:
Let his children be wandering beggars;
    let them seek their bread far from their desolate places.
109.11:
Let the creditor seize all that he has;
    let the strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.
109.12:
Let there be none to extend mercy unto him,
    neither let there be any to pity his fatherless children.
109.13:
Let his posterity be cut off,
    and in the generation following let his name be blotted out.
109.14:
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord,
    and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
109.15:
Let them be before the Lord continually,
    that the Lord may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
109.16:
For he did not remember to show kindness,
    but pursued the poor and needy and broken-hearted
    to their death.
109.17:
As he loved cursing,
    so let it come over him;
as he did not delight in blessing,
    so let it be far from him.
109.18:
As he clothed himself with cursing like a garment,
    so let it soak into him like water,
    and like oil into his bones.
109.19:
Let it be unto him as the garment that covers him,
    and a belt that he continually wears.
109.20:
Let this be the reward of my adversaries from the Lord,
    and of those who speak evil against my soul.
109.22:
For I am poor and needy,
    and my heart is wounded within me.
109.23:
I am gone like a shadow in the evening;
    I am tossed as the locust.
109.24:
My knees are weak through fasting,
    and my body is thin with no fat.
109.25:
I am a reproach to my accusers;
    when they look upon me, they shake their heads.
109.26:
Help me, O Lord my God!
    Save me according to Your mercy,
109.27:
that they may know that this is by Your hand,
    that You, O Lord, have done it.
109.29:
Let my adversaries be clothed with shame,
    and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace like a cloak.
109.30:
I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth;
    indeed, I will praise Him among the multitude.
109.31:
For He stands at the right hand of the poor,
    to save him from those who condemn his soul to death.

110.1:
The Lord said to my lord,
    “Sit at My right hand,
until I make your enemies
    your footstool.”
110.2:
The Lord shall send your mighty scepter out of Zion;
    rule in the midst of your enemies.
110.3:
Your people will follow you
    in the day of your battle;
on the holy mountains
    at dawn of the morning,
    the dew of your youth belongs to you.
110.4:
The Lord has sworn
    and will not change,
“You are a priest forever
    after the order of Melchizedek.”
110.5:
The Lord is at your right hand;
    He shall strike down kings in the day of His wrath.
110.6:
He shall judge among the nations; He shall fill them with dead bodies;
    He shall scatter heads all over the land.
110.7:
He shall drink of the brook in the path;
    then He shall lift up the head.

111.1:
Praise the Lord! 
I will praise the Lord with my whole heart,
    in the assembly of the upright, and in the congregation.
111.2:
The works of the Lord are great,
    sought out by all who have pleasure in them.
111.3:
His work is honorable and glorious,
    and His righteousness endures forever.
111.4:
He has made His wonderful works to be remembered;
    the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.
111.5:
He has given food to those who fear Him;
    He will ever be mindful of His covenant.
111.6:
He has shown His people the power of His works,
    that He may give them the inheritance of the nations.
111.7:
The works of His hands are true and just;
    all His commands are sure.
111.8:
They stand forever and ever,
    and are done in truth and uprightness.

112.1:
Praise the Lord! 
Blessed is the man who fears the Lord,
    who delights greatly in His commandments.
112.2:
His offspring shall be mighty in the land;
    the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
112.3:
Wealth and riches shall be in his house,
    and his righteousness endures forever.
112.4:
To the upright there arises light in the darkness;
    he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
112.5:
A good man shows generous favor, and lends;
    he will guide his affairs with justice.
112.6:
Surely the righteous man shall not be moved;
    the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
112.7:
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings;
    his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
112.8:
His heart is established; he shall not be afraid,
    until he sees triumph upon his enemies.

113.1:
Praise the Lord!
