Praise, O you servants of the Lord,
    praise the name of the Lord.
113.2:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
    from this time forth and for evermore.
113.3:
From the rising of the sun to its going down,
    the Lord’s name is to be praised.
113.4:
The Lord is high above all nations,
    and His glory above the heavens.
113.5:
Who is like the Lord our God,
    who dwells on high,
113.6:
who looks down on the things
    that are in heaven and on the earth?
113.7:
He raises up the poor out of the dust
    and lifts the needy out of the ash heap,
113.8:
to make them sit with princes,
    even with the princes of His people.
113.9:
He gives the barren woman a dwelling,
    making her the joyful mother of children. 
Praise the Lord!

114.1:
When Israel went out of Egypt,
    the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
114.2:
Judah was His sanctuary,
    and Israel His dominion.
114.3:
The sea saw it and fled;
    the Jordan was driven back;
114.4:
the mountains skipped like rams
    and the hills like lambs.
114.5:
What alarmed you, O sea, that you fled,
    O Jordan, that you turned back,
114.6:
O mountains, that you skipped like rams,
    O hills, like lambs?
114.7:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
    at the presence of the God of Jacob
114.8:
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
    the hard stone into a spring of waters.

115.1:
Not unto us, O Lord, not unto us,
    but unto Your name give glory,
    for the sake of Your mercy, and for the sake of Your truth.
115.2:
Why should the nations say,
    “Where now is their God?”
115.3:
But our God is in the heavens;
    He does whatever He pleases.
115.4:
Their idols are silver and gold,
    the work of men’s hands.
115.5:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak;
    eyes, but they cannot see;
115.6:
they have ears, but they cannot hear;
    noses, but they cannot smell;
115.8:
Those who make them are like them;
    so is everyone who trusts in them.
115.9:
O Israel, trust in the Lord;
    He is their help and their shield.
115.10:
O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord;
    He is their help and their shield.
115.11:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
    He is their help and their shield.
115.13:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
    both the small and great ones.
115.14:
The Lord shall increase you more and more,
    you and your children.
115.15:
You are blessed of the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
115.16:
The heavens belong to the Lord,
    but the earth He has given to the children of men.
115.17:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
    nor do any who go down into silence.
115.18:
But we will bless the Lord
    from this time and for evermore. 
Praise the Lord!

116.1:
I love the Lord, because He has heard my voice
    and my supplications.
116.2:
Because He has inclined His ear to me,
    therefore I will call upon Him as long as I live.
116.4:
Then called I upon the name of the Lord:
    “O Lord, I plead with You, deliver my soul.”
116.5:
Gracious is the Lord, and righteous;
    indeed, our God is merciful.
116.6:
The Lord protects the simple;
    I was brought low, and He helped me.
116.7:
Return to your rest, O my soul;
    for the Lord has vindicated you.
116.8:
For You have delivered my soul from death,
    my eyes from tears,
    and my feet from falling.
116.9:
I will walk before the Lord
    in the land of the living.
116.10:
I believed, indeed I have spoken:
    “I am greatly afflicted.”
116.11:
I said in my haste,
    “All men are liars.”
116.12:
What shall I render unto the Lord
    for all His benefits toward me?
116.13:
I will take the cup of salvation
    and call upon the name of the Lord.
116.14:
I will pay my vows unto the Lord
    now in the presence of all His people.
116.15:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
    is the death of His godly ones.
116.17:
I will offer to You the sacrifice of thanksgiving
    and will call upon the name of the Lord.
116.18:
I will pay my vows unto the Lord
    now in the presence of all His people,
116.19:
in the courts of the house of the Lord,
    in your midst, O Jerusalem. 
Praise the Lord!

117.1:
Praise the Lord, all you nations!
    Exalt Him, all you peoples!
117.2:
For His merciful kindness is great toward us,
    and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. 
Praise the Lord!

118.1:
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good,
    because His mercy endures forever.
118.2:
Let Israel say,
    “His mercy endures forever.”
118.3:
Let the house of Aaron say,
    “His mercy endures forever.”
118.4:
Let those who fear the Lord say,
    “His mercy endures forever.”
118.5:
I called upon the Lord from my distress;
    the Lord answered me and set me in an open place.
118.6:
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear.
    What can people do to me?
118.7:
The Lord is on my side to help me;
    I shall look in triumph upon those who hate me.
118.8:
It is better to trust in the Lord
    than to put confidence in man.
118.9:
It is better to trust in the Lord
    than to put confidence in princes.
118.10:
All nations encircled me,
    but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.
118.11:
They circled me; indeed, they surrounded me,
    but in the name of the Lord I will destroy them.
118.13:
You have pushed against me, that I was falling,
    but the Lord helped me.
118.14:
The Lord is my strength and song;
    He has become my salvation.
118.15:
The voice of rejoicing and salvation
    is in the tents of the righteous:
“The right hand of the Lord is valiant.
118.16:
The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
    the right hand of the Lord is valiant.”
118.17:
I shall not die, but I shall live
    and declare the works of the Lord.
118.18:
The Lord has severely chastened me,
    but He has not given me over unto death.
118.19:
Open to me the gates of righteousness;
    I will go into them, and I will praise the Lord.
118.20:
This is the gate of the Lord;
    the righteous shall enter through.
118.21:
I will thank You that You have heard me
    and have become my deliverance.
118.22:
The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
118.23:
This is what the Lord has done;
    it is marvelous in our eyes.
118.24:
This is the day that the Lord has made;
    we will rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25:
Save us, we ask You, O Lord;
    O Lord, we ask You, send now success.
118.26:
Blessed be he that comes in the name of the Lord:
    we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.
118.27:
The Lord is God,
    and He has shown us His light;
bind the sacrifice with cords,
    even unto the horns of the altar.
118.28:
You are my God, and I will praise You;
    You are my God, I will exalt You.
118.29:
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good,
    for His mercy endures forever.

119.1:
Blessed are those whose way is blameless,
    who walk in the law of the Lord.
119.2:
Blessed are those who keep His testimonies,
    and who seek Him with all their heart.
119.3:
They also do no wrong;
    they walk in His ways.
119.4:
You have commanded us
    to keep Your precepts diligently.
119.5:
Oh, that my ways were established
    to keep Your statutes!
119.6:
Then I shall not be ashamed,
    when I have my focus on all Your commandments.
119.7:
I will praise You with an upright heart,
    when I have learned Your righteous judgments.
119.8:
I will keep Your statutes;
    do not completely abandon me.
119.9:
How shall a young man keep his way pure?
    By keeping it according to Your word.
119.10:
With my whole heart I seek You;
    do not allow me to wander from Your commandments.
119.11:
Your word I have hidden in my heart,
    that I might not sin against You.
119.12:
Blessed are You, O Lord;
    teach me Your statutes.
119.13:
With my lips I declare
    all the decrees of Your mouth.
119.14:
I rejoice in the way of Your testimonies,
    as much as in all riches.
119.15:
I will meditate on Your precepts
    and keep my eyes on Your ways.
119.16:
I will delight in Your statutes;
    I will not forget Your word.
119.17:
Deal kindly with Your servant, that I may live
    and keep Your word.
119.18:
Open my eyes, that I may behold
    wondrous things from Your law.
119.19:
I am a sojourner in the land;
    do not hide Your commandments from me.
119.20:
My soul is consumed all the time
    with a longing for Your decrees.
119.21:
You have rebuked the proud, those cursed,
    who depart from Your commandments.
119.22:
Remove from me reproach and contempt,
    for I have kept Your testimonies.
119.23:
Even if princes sit and conspire against me,
    Your servant will meditate on Your statutes.
119.24:
Your testimonies are my delight
    and my counselors.
119.25:
My soul clings to the dust;
    revive me according to Your word.
119.26:
I have declared my ways, and You heard me;
    teach me Your statutes.
119.27:
Make me to understand the way of Your precepts;
    then I shall contemplate on Your wondrous works.
119.28:
My soul collapses on account of grief;
    strengthen me according to Your word.
119.29:
Remove from me the way of falsehood,
    and graciously grant me Your law.
119.30:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
    Your judgments I have laid before me.
119.31:
I have stayed with Your testimonies, O Lord;
    may I not be put to shame.
119.32:
I will run in the way of Your commandments,
    when You set my heart free.
119.33:
Teach me, O Lord, the way of Your statutes,
    and I shall keep it to the end.
119.34:
Give me understanding, and I shall keep Your law
    and observe it with my whole heart.
119.35:
Lead me in the path of Your commandments,
    for I delight in them.
119.36:
Incline my heart unto Your testimonies,
    and not for unjust gain.
119.37:
Turn away my eyes from beholding worthlessness,
    and revive me in Your way.
119.38:
Establish Your word to Your servant,
    so that You are feared.
119.39:
Turn away my reproach that I dread,
    for Your judgments are good.
119.40:
Behold, I have a longing for Your precepts;
    revive me in Your righteousness.
119.41:
Let Your mercies come to me, O Lord,
    even Your deliverance according to Your word.
119.42:
So I shall have an answer for him who reproaches me,
    for I trust in Your word.
119.43:
Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth,
    for I have hoped in Your judgments.
119.44:
So I shall keep Your law continually,
    forever and ever.
119.45:
I will walk in an open space,
    for I seek Your precepts.
119.46:
I will speak of Your testimonies also before kings
    and will not be ashamed.
119.47:
I will delight in Your commandments,
    which I have loved.
119.48:
My hands I will lift up unto Your commandments, which I have loved;
    I will meditate on Your statutes.
119.49:
Remember Your word to Your servant,
    on which You have caused me to hope.
119.50:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
    for Your word revives me.
119.51:
The proud ones have derided me,
    yet I have not forsaken Your law.
119.52:
I remembered Your judgments of old, O Lord,
    and I have comforted myself.
119.53:
Fury has taken hold of me because of the wicked
    who forsake Your law.
119.54:
Your statutes have been my songs
    in the house of my temporary dwelling.
119.55:
I have remembered Your name, O Lord, in the night,
    and have kept Your law.
119.56:
This is my blessing,
    because I have kept Your precepts.
119.57:
You are my portion, O Lord;
    I have said that I would keep Your words.
119.58:
I seek Your favor with my whole heart;
    be merciful to me according to Your word.
119.59:
I consider my ways,
    and I turn my feet to Your testimonies.
119.60:
I made haste, and I did not delay
    to keep Your commandments.
119.61:
The bands of the wicked have trapped me,
    but I have not forgotten Your law.
119.62:
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You,
    because of Your righteous judgments.
119.63:
I am a companion of all who fear You,
    and of those who keep Your precepts.
119.64:
The earth, O Lord, is full of Your mercy;
    teach me Your statutes.
119.65:
You have been good to Your servant,
    O Lord, according to Your word.
119.66:
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
    for I have believed Your commandments.
119.67:
Before I was afflicted I wandered,
    but now I keep Your word.
119.68:
You are good and do good;
    teach me Your statutes.
119.69:
The proud have spoken lies against me,
    but I keep Your precepts with my whole heart.
119.70:
Their heart is as thick as fat,
    but I delight in Your law.
119.71:
It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
    that I might learn Your statutes.
119.72:
The law from Your mouth is better to me
    than thousands of gold and silver coins.
119.73:
Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
    give me understanding, that I may learn Your commandments.
119.74:
Those who fear You will be glad when they see me,
    because I have hoped in Your word.
119.75:
I know, O Lord, that Your judgments are right,
    and that You in faithfulness have afflicted me.
119.76:
Let Your merciful kindness comfort me,
    according to Your word to Your servant.
119.77:
Let Your compassion come to me, that I may live,
    for Your law is my delight.
119.78:
Let the proud be ashamed, for they have been wicked to me in falsehood,
    but I will meditate on Your precepts.
119.79:
Let those who fear You turn to me,
    that they might know Your testimonies.
119.80:
Let my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
    that I may not be ashamed.
119.81:
My soul longs for Your deliverance,
    but I hope in Your word.
119.82:
My eyes are weary for Your word,
    saying, “When will You comfort me?”
119.83:
For I have become like a wineskin dried in the smoke,
    yet I have not forgotten Your statutes.
119.84:
How many days are given to Your servant?
    When will You provide judgment on those who persecute me?
119.85:
The proud have dug pits for me,
    and they do not live in accordance to Your law.
119.86:
All Your commandments are faithful;
    I am persecuted without cause; help me!
119.87:
They have almost consumed me on the earth,
    but I have not abandoned Your precepts.
119.88:
Revive me according to Your lovingkindness,
    that I may keep the testimony from Your mouth.
119.89:
Forever, O Lord, Your word
    is established in heaven.
119.90:
Your faithfulness is for all generations;
    You have established the earth, and it is firm.
119.91:
They continue this day according to Your ordinance,
    for all are Your servants.
119.92:
Unless Your law had been my delight,
    I would have perished in my affliction.
119.93:
I will never forget Your precepts,
    for with them You have revived me.
119.94:
I am Yours; deliver me,
    for I have sought Your precepts.
119.95:
The wicked have waited to destroy me,
    but I will consider Your testimonies.
119.96:
I have seen that all perfection has an end,
    but Your commandment is quite broad.
119.97:
Oh, how I love Your law!
    It is my meditation all the day.
119.98:
Your commandments have made me wiser than my enemies,
    for they are continually with me.
119.99:
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
    for Your testimonies are my meditation.
119.100:
I understand more than the elders,
    because I keep Your precepts.
119.101:
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
    that I might keep Your word.
119.102:
I have not departed from Your judgments,
    for You have taught me.
119.103:
How sweet are Your words to the taste of my mouth!
    Sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104:
Through Your precepts I receive understanding;
    therefore I hate every false way.
119.105:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
    and a light to my path.
119.106:
I have sworn, and I will perform it,
    that I will keep Your righteous judgments.
119.107:
I am greatly afflicted;
    revive me, O Lord, according to Your word.
119.108:
Accept the freewill offerings of my praise, O Lord,
    and teach me Your judgments.
119.109:
My soul is continually in my hand,
    yet I do not forget Your law.
119.110:
The wicked have laid a trap for me,
    yet I do not depart from Your precepts.
119.111:
Your testimonies are my inheritance forever,
    for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
119.112:
I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes always,
    even unto the end.
119.113:
I hate those who are double-minded,
    but I love Your law.
119.114:
You are my hiding place and my shield,
    I hope in Your word.
119.115:
Depart from me, you who are wicked,
    for I keep the commandments of my God.
119.116:
Uphold me according to Your word, that I may live,
    and let me not be ashamed with my hope.
119.117:
Hold me up, and I shall be safe,
    and I will have respect for Your statutes continually.
119.118:
You have rejected all those who stray from Your statutes,
    for their deceit is falsehood.
119.119:
You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross;
    therefore I love Your testimonies.
119.120:
My body trembles for fear of You,
    and I am afraid of Your judgments.
119.121:
I have done what is right and just;
    do not abandon me to my oppressors.
119.122:
Be true to Your servant for good;
    let not the proud ones oppress me.
119.123:
My eyes long for Your deliverance
    and for the promise of Your righteousness.
119.124:
Deal with Your servant according to Your mercy,
    and teach me Your statutes.
119.125:
I am Your servant; grant me understanding,
    that I may know Your testimonies.
119.126:
It is time for You, O Lord, to act,
    for they have broken Your law.
119.127:
Therefore I love Your commandments
    above gold, even fine gold.
119.128:
For I follow all Your precepts to be right,
    and I hate every false way.
119.129:
Your testimonies are wonderful;
    therefore my soul keeps them.
119.130:
The giving of Your words gives light;
    it grants understanding to the simple.
119.131:
I opened my mouth and panted,
    for I long for Your commandments.
119.132:
Look upon me, and be merciful to me,
    as You are for those who love Your name.
119.133:
Order my steps according to Your word,
    and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
119.134:
Deliver me from the oppression of man,
    so I will keep Your precepts.
119.135:
Make Your face to shine upon Your servant,
    and teach me Your statutes.
119.136:
Rivers of waters run down my eyes,
    because people do not keep Your law.
119.137:
You are righteous, O Lord,
    and upright are Your judgments.
119.138:
You have set Your testimonies in righteousness
    and faithfulness.
119.139:
My zeal has consumed me,
    because my enemies have forgotten Your words.
119.140:
Your word is pure and true;
    therefore Your servant loves it.
119.141:
I am small and despised,
    yet I do not forget Your precepts.
119.142:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
    and Your law is true.
119.143:
Trouble and anguish have discovered me,
    but Your commandments are my delight.
119.144:
The righteousness of Your testimonies is everlasting;
    grant me understanding, and I shall live.
119.145:
I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O Lord,
    I will keep Your statutes.
119.146:
I cried unto You; deliver me,
    and I shall keep Your testimonies.
119.147:
I arose before the dawn of the morning and cried for help;
    I hope in Your words.
119.148:
My eyes are awake before the night watches,
    that I might meditate on Your word.
119.149:
Hear my voice according to Your lovingkindness, O Lord;
    revive me according to Your judgment.
119.150:
They draw close, those who persecute me with evil;
    they are far from Your law.
119.151:
But You are near, O Lord,
    and all Your commandments are true.
119.152:
I have known of old
    that You have established Your testimonies forever.
119.153:
Consider my affliction, and deliver me,
    for I do not forget Your law.
119.154:
Plead my cause, and defend me;
    revive me according to Your word.
119.155:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
    for they do not seek Your statutes.
119.156:
Great are Your compassions, O Lord;
    revive me according to Your judgments.
119.157:
Many are my persecutors and my enemies,
    yet I do not turn from Your testimonies.
119.158:
I behold the transgressors with disgust,
    because they have not kept Your word.
119.159:
Consider how I love Your precepts;
    revive me, O Lord, according to Your lovingkindness.
119.160:
Your word is true from the beginning,
    and every one of Your righteous judgments endures forever.
119.161:
Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
    but my heart stands in awe of Your words.
119.162:
I rejoice at Your word,
    as one who finds great plunder.
119.163:
I hate and abhor lying,
    but I love Your law.
119.164:
Seven times a day I praise You,
    because of Your righteous judgments.
119.165:
Those who love Your law have great peace,
    and nothing shall cause them to stumble.
119.166:
Lord, I have hoped for Your deliverance,
    and I carry out Your commandments.
119.167:
My soul has kept Your testimonies,
    and I love them greatly.
119.168:
I have kept Your precepts and Your testimonies,
    for all my ways are before You.
119.169:
Let my cry come near before You, O Lord;
    give me understanding according to Your word.
119.170:
Let my supplication come before You;
    deliver me according to Your word.
119.171:
My lips shall declare praise,
    for You have taught me Your statutes.
119.172:
My tongue shall speak of Your word,
    for all Your commandments are right.
119.173:
Let Your hand help me,
    for I have chosen Your precepts.
119.174:
I have longed for Your salvation, O Lord,
    and Your law is my delight.
119.175:
Let my soul live and praise You,
    and let Your judgments come to my aid.

120.1:
In my distress I cried unto the Lord,
    and He heard me.
120.2:
Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips
    and from a deceitful tongue.
120.3:
What shall be given to you,
    or what shall be done to you, you false tongue?
120.4:
Sharp arrows of the warrior,
    with coals of the broom tree!
120.5:
Woe is me, that I have sojourned in Meshek,
    or that I have dwelled among the tents of Kedar!
120.6:
My soul has long lived
    with those who hate peace.
120.7:
I am for peace,
    but when I speak, they are for war!

121.1:
I will lift up my eyes to the hills,
    from where does my help come?
121.2:
My help comes from the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.
121.3:
He will not let your foot slip;
    He who keeps you will not slumber.
121.4:
Behold, He who guards Israel
    shall neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5:
The Lord is your guardian;
    the Lord is your shade at your right hand.
121.6:
The sun shall not harm you during the day,
    nor the moon during the night.
121.7:
The Lord shall protect you from all evil;
    He shall preserve your soul.
121.8:
The Lord shall preserve your going out and your coming in
    from now and for evermore.

122.1:
I was glad when they said to me,
    “Let us go into the house of the Lord.”
122.2:
Our feet shall stand
    within your gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3:
Jerusalem is built as a city
    that is designed for a multitude,
122.4:
where the tribes go up,
    the tribes of the Lord,
as a decree of Israel,
    to give thanks unto the name of the Lord.
122.5:
There are set thrones of judgment,
    the thrones of the house of David.
122.6:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
    “May they prosper who love you!
122.7:
Peace be within your walls
    and security within your towers!”
122.8:
For my brothers and companions’ sake,
    I will now say, “Peace be within you.”
122.9:
Because of the house of the Lord our God,
    I will seek your good.

123.1:
To You I lift up my eyes,
    O You who dwell in the heavens.
123.2:
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
    and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look upon the Lord our God,
    until He has mercy upon us.
123.3:
Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us,
    for we have been completely filled with contempt.
123.4:
Our soul is exceedingly filled with the ridicule of those who are at ease,
    and with the contempt of the proud ones.

124.1:
If it had not been the Lord who was on our side,
    now may Israel say,
124.2:
if it had not been the Lord who was on our side,
    when men rose up against us,
124.3:
then they would have swallowed us up,
    when their wrath was kindled against us;
124.4:
then the flood would have overwhelmed us,
    the torrent would have passed over our lives;
124.5:
then the surging waters
    would have gone over us.
124.6:
Blessed be the Lord,
    who has not given us for a prey to their teeth.
124.7:
We have escaped
    as a bird out of the snare of the hunters;
the snare is broken,
    and we have escaped.
124.8:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
    who made heaven and earth.

125.1:
Those who trust in the Lord shall be as Mount Zion,
    which cannot be removed, but abides forever.
125.2:
As the mountains are around Jerusalem,
    so the Lord surrounds His people,
    from now and forever.
125.3:
For the scepter of the wicked shall not rest
    upon the land allotted to the righteous,
lest the righteous put forth
    their hands to do iniquity.
125.4:
Do good, O Lord, for those who are good,
    and to those who are upright in their hearts.
125.5:
As for those who turn aside to their twisted ways,
    the Lord shall lead them away with the other workers of iniquity. 
Peace be upon Israel!

126.1:
When the Lord restored the captives of Zion,
    we were like those who dream.
126.2:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter,
    and our tongue with singing.
Then they said among the nations,
    “The Lord has done great things for them.”
126.3:
The Lord has done great things for us;
    we are glad.
126.4:
Restore our captives, O Lord,
    as the streams in the Negev.
126.5:
Those who sow in tears
    shall reap in joy.
126.6:
He who goes forth and weeps,
    bearing precious seed to sow,
shall come home again with rejoicing,
    bringing his grain sheaves with him.

127.2:
It is in vain for you to rise up early,
    to stay up late,
and to eat the bread of hard toil,
    for He gives sleep to His beloved.
127.3:
Look, children are a gift of the Lord,
    and the fruit of the womb is a reward.
127.4:
As arrows in the hand of a mighty warrior,
    so are the children of one’s youth.
127.5:
Happy is the man
    who has his quiver full of them;
he shall not be ashamed
    when he speaks with the enemies at the gate.

128.1:
Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord,
    who walks in His ways.
128.2:
For you shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands;
    you will be happy, and it shall be well with you.
128.3:
Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine
    in your house,
your children like olive shoots
    around your table.
128.4:
Behold, this man shall be blessed
    who fears the Lord.
128.5:
The Lord shall bless you from Zion,
    and may you see the welfare of Jerusalem
all the days of your life.
128.6:
Indeed, may you see your children’s children.
Peace upon Israel!

129.1:
“Often they have afflicted me from my youth,”
    may Israel now say,
129.2:
“often they have afflicted me from my youth,
    yet they have not prevailed against me.
129.3:
The plowmen plowed upon my back;
    they made their furrows long.”
129.4:
The Lord is righteous;
    He has cut the cords of the wicked.
129.5:
Let all those be shamed
    and turned back who hate Zion.
129.6:
Let them be as the grass on the housetops,
    which withers before it even grows,
129.7:
where the reaper is unable to fill his hand,
    or he who binds sheaves, his arms.

130.1: From the depths I call on You, O Lord!
130.3:
If you, O Lord, should keep track of iniquities,
    O Lord, who shall stand?
130.4:
For there is forgiveness with You,
    that You may be feared.
130.5:
I wait for the Lord, with bated breath I wait;
    I long for His Word!
130.6:
My soul waits for the Lord,
    more than watchmen for the morning,
    more than watchmen for the morning.
130.8:
He shall redeem Israel
    from all their iniquities.

131.1:
Lord, my heart is not haughty,
    my eyes are not raised too high.
I have not striven for enormities,
    for things too wonderful for me.
131.3:
Let Israel hope in the Lord
    from now and forever.

132.1:
O Lord, remember David
    and all his afflictions,
132.2:
how he swore unto the Lord,
    and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob:
132.3:
“I will not come into my house,
    nor go up to my bed;
132.4:
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
    or slumber to my eyelids,
132.5:
until I find a place for the Lord,
    a dwelling for the mighty God of Jacob.”
132.6:
We heard of it in Ephrathah;
    we found it in the fields of Jaar.
132.7:
“We will go to His dwelling place,
    we will worship at His footstool.”
132.8:
Arise, O Lord, go to Your resting place,
    You and the ark of Your strength.
132.9:
Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness,
    and let Your godly ones shout for joy.
132.10:
For Your servant David’s sake,
    do not turn away Your anointed king.
132.11:
The Lord has sworn with a sure oath to David
    that He will not turn from it:
“From the fruit of your body
    I will set a son on your throne.
132.12:
If your children will keep My covenant
    and My testimonies that I shall teach them,
then their children shall also sit
    upon your throne forever.”
132.13:
For the Lord has chosen Zion;
    He has desired it for His dwelling:
132.14:
“This is My resting place forever;
    here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.
132.15:
I will abundantly bless her provisions;
    I will satisfy her poor with bread.
132.16:
I will also clothe her priests with salvation,
    and her godly ones shall shout for joy.
132.17:
“There I will make a horn sprout for David;
    I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.
132.18:
His enemies I will clothe with shame,
    but on him his crown will shine.”

133.1:
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
    for brothers to dwell together in unity!
133.2:
It is like precious oil upon the head,
    that runs down on the beard—
even Aaron’s beard—
    and going down to the collar of his garments;
133.3:
as the dew of Hermon,
    that descends upon the mountains of Zion,
for there the Lord has commanded the blessing,
    even life forever.

134.1:
Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
    who by night stand in the house of the Lord.
134.2:
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary,
    and bless the Lord.
134.3:
May the Lord who made heaven and earth
    bless you from Zion.

135.1:
Praise the Lord! 
Praise the name of the Lord
    praise Him, O servants of the Lord,
135.2:
you who stand in the house of the Lord,
    in the courts of the house of our God!
135.3:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
    sing praises unto His name, for it is pleasant.
135.4:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself,
    and Israel for His special possession.
135.5:
For I know that the Lord is great,
    and that our Lord is above all gods.
135.6:
Whatever the Lord pleases,
    He does in heaven and on earth,
    in the seas and all the depths.
135.8:
He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
    both of man and animal.
135.9:
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
    against Pharaoh and all his servants;
135.10:
He struck down great nations
    and slew mighty kings—
135.11:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
    and Og king of Bashan,
    and all the kingdoms of Canaan—
135.12:
and gave their land for an inheritance,
    a possession to Israel His people.
135.13:
Your name, O Lord, endures forever;
    and Your renown, O Lord, throughout all generations.
135.14:
For the Lord will defend His people,
    and He will have compassion on His servants.
135.15:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
    the work of men’s hands.
135.16:
They have mouths, but do not speak;
    they have eyes, but do not see;
135.17:
they have ears, but do not hear;
    neither is there any breath in their mouths.
135.18:
Those who make them are like them;
    so is everyone who trusts in them.
135.19:
Bless the Lord, O house of Israel;
    bless the Lord, O house of Aaron.
135.20:
Bless the Lord, O house of Levi;
    you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
135.21:
Blessed be the Lord from Zion,
    who dwells at Jerusalem. 
Praise you the Lord!

136.1:
Oh, give thanks unto the Lord, for He is good,
    for His mercy endures forever.
136.2:
Oh, give thanks unto the God of gods,
    for His mercy endures forever.
136.3:
Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords,
    for His mercy endures forever:
136.4:
to Him who alone does great wonders,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.5:
to Him who by wisdom made the heavens,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.6:
to Him who stretched out the earth above the waters,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.7:
to Him who made the great heavenly lights,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.8:
the sun to rule over the day,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.9:
the moon and stars to rule over the night,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.10:
to Him who struck down in Egypt their firstborn,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.11:
and brought out Israel from among them,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.12:
with a strong hand and a stretched-out arm,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.13:
to Him who divided the Red Sea into two,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.14:
and made Israel to pass through the midst of it,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.15:
but overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.16:
to Him who led His people through the wilderness,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.17:
to Him who struck down great kings,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.18:
and slew mighty kings,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.19:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.20:
and Og king of Bashan,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.21:
and gave their land for a possession,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.22:
even an inheritance to Israel His servant,
    for His mercy endures forever.
136.23:
Who remembered us in our low place,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.24:
and has redeemed us from our enemies,
    for His mercy endures forever;
136.25:
who gives food to all people,
    for His mercy endures forever.
136.26:
Give thanks unto the God of heaven,
    for His mercy endures forever.

137.1:
By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down and wept
    when we remembered Zion.
137.2:
We hung our harps
    upon the poplars.
137.3:
For there our captors made us sing
    and our tormentors made us entertain,
    saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
137.4:
How shall we sing the song of the Lord
    in a foreign land?
137.5:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
    let my right hand forget its skill.
137.6:
If I do not remember you,
    let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth,
if I do not have Jerusalem
    as my highest joy.
137.7:
Remember, O Lord, the people of Edom
    in the day of Jerusalem,
who said, “Raze it, raze it,
    down to its foundations.”
137.8:
O daughter of Babylon, who is to be destroyed,
    blessed is the one who rewards you
    as you have done to us.
137.9:
Blessed is the one who takes
    and dashes your little ones against the rocks.

138.1:
I will praise You, O Lord, with my whole heart;
    before the gods I will sing Your praise.
138.2:
I will worship toward Your holy temple,
    and praise Your name
    for Your lovingkindness and for Your truth;
for You have exalted Your word
    above all Your name.
138.3:
On the day I called, You answered me,
    and strengthened me in my soul.
138.4:
All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O Lord,
    for they have heard the words of Your mouth.
138.5:
Indeed, they shall sing of the ways of the Lord,
    for great is the glory of the Lord.
138.6:
Though the Lord is exalted, yet He has concern for the lowly,
    but the proud one He knows from a distance.
138.7:
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
    You will preserve me;
You stretch forth Your hand against the wrath of my enemies,
    and Your right hand saves me.

139.1:
O Lord, You have searched me
    and known me.
139.2:
You know when I sit down and when I get up;
    You understand my thought from far off.
139.3:
You search my path and my lying down
    and are aware of all my ways.
139.4:
For there is not a word on my tongue,
    but behold, O Lord, You know it fully.
139.5:
You put Yourself behind and before me,
    and keep Your hand on me.
139.6:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
    it is lofty, and I cannot fathom it.
139.7:
Where shall I go from Your spirit,
    or where shall I flee from Your presence?
139.8:
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
    if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there.
139.9:
If I take the wings of the morning
    and dwell at the end of the sea,
139.10:
even there Your hand shall guide me,
    and Your right hand shall take hold of me.
139.11:
If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,
    and the light shall be as night about me,”
139.12:
even the darkness is not dark to You,
    but the night shines as the day,
    for the darkness is like light to You.
139.13:
You brought my inner parts into being;
    You wove me in my mother’s womb.
139.15:
My frame was not hidden from You
    when I was made in secret,
and intricately put together in the lowest parts of the earth.
139.16:
Your eyes saw me unformed,
yet in Your book
    all my days were written,
    before any of them came into being.
139.17:
How precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God!
    How great is the sum of them!
139.18:
If I should count them,
    they are more in number than the sand;
when I awake,
    I am still with You.
139.19:
If only You would slay the wicked, O God!
    O violent men, depart from me.
139.20:
For they speak against You with malice,
    and Your enemies take your name in vain.
139.21:
Do I not hate those, O Lord, who hate You?
    And do I not abhor those who rise up against You?
139.22:
I hate them with perfect hatred;
    I count them my enemies.
139.23:
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
    try me, and know my concerns,
139.24:
and see if there is any rebellious way in me,
    and lead me in the ancient way.

140.1:
Deliver me, O Lord, from evil men;
    protect me from violent men,
140.2:
who plan evil deeds in their heart
    and continually gather together for conflicts.
140.3:
They have tongues as sharp as a serpent;
    adders’ poison is with their lips. Selah
140.6:
I said to the Lord, “You are my God;
    hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.”
140.7:
O God my Lord, the strength of my salvation,
    You have covered my head in the day of battle.
140.9:
As for the head of those who encompass me,
    let the mischief of their own lips overwhelm them;
140.11:
Let not an evil speaker be established in the land;
    let evil hunt the violent man to overthrow him!
140.12:
I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted
    and will give justice to the poor.
140.13:
Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto Your name;
    the upright shall dwell in Your presence.

141.1:
Lord, I cry unto You; make haste to me;
    give ear to my voice, when I cry unto You.
141.2:
Let my prayer be set forth before You as incense,
    and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
141.3:
Set a guard, O Lord, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips.
141.4:
Do not let my heart be drawn to any evil,
    to practice wicked deeds
with men who do iniquity,
    and do not let me eat of their delights.
141.6:
When their judges are thrown to stony places,
    then they shall hear my words, for they are sweet.
141.7:
As when one plows to break up the land,
    so our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
141.8:
But my eyes are unto You, O God my Lord,
    in You is my trust; do not leave my soul defenseless.
141.9:
Keep me from the snares that they have laid for me,
    and the traps of those who do iniquity.
141.10:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
    while I pass by and escape.

142.1:
I cried unto the Lord with my voice;
    with my voice I made my supplication unto the Lord.
142.2:
I poured out my complaint before Him;
    I declared to Him my trouble.
142.3:
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
    then You knew my path.
In the way where I walk,
    they have laid a snare for me.
142.6:
Attend to my cry,
    for I am brought very low;
deliver me from my persecutors,
    for they are stronger than me.
142.7:
Bring my soul out of prison,
    that I may praise Your name;
the righteous shall surround me,
    for You shall deal bountifully with me.

143.1:
Hear my prayer, O Lord,
    give ear to my supplications;
in Your faithfulness answer me,
    and in Your righteousness.
143.2:
Enter not into judgment with Your servant,
    for in Your sight no one living is righteous.
143.4:
Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me;
    my heart within me is desolate.
143.6:
I stretch forth my hands unto You;
    my soul thirsts after You as a thirsty land. Selah
143.7:
Respond to me quickly, O Lord,
    my spirit fails;
do not hide Your face from me,
    lest I be like those who go down into the pit.
143.9:
Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies;
    I flee unto You for my protection.
143.10:
Teach me to do Your will,
    for You are my God;
may Your good spirit
    lead me onto level ground.
143.11:
Revive me, O Lord, for Your name’s sake,
    for Your righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12:
In Your mercy cut off my enemies,
    and destroy all them who afflict my soul,
    for I am Your servant.

144.3:
O Lord, who is man that You take notice of him
    or the son of a man that You make account of him?
144.4:
Man is like a breath;
    his days are as a shadow that passes away.
144.5:
Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down;
    touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144.6:
Cast forth lightning, and scatter them;
    shoot out Your arrows, and destroy them.
144.8:
whose mouth speaks lies,
    and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9:
I will sing a new song unto You, O God,
    on a harp and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises unto You;
144.10:
it is He who gives victory to kings,
    who delivers David His servant from the cruel sword.
144.11:
Rescue me and deliver me
    from the hand of foreigners,
whose mouths speak lies
    and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.12:
May our sons in their youth
    be like plants full grown,
and our daughters like cornerstones,
    cut in the similitude of a palace,
144.13:
that our granaries may be full,
    providing all manner of produce,
that our sheep may bring forth
    thousands and ten thousands in our fields,
144.14:
and may our cattle be strong in labor.
May there be no breaking in
    or going out,
    and no wailing in our streets.
144.15:
Blessed are the people who have such things;
    indeed, blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.

145.1:
I will exalt you, my God and King,
    and I will bless Your name forever and ever.
145.2:
Every day I will bless You,
    and I will praise Your name forever and ever.
145.3:
Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised,
    and His greatness is unfathomable.
145.4:
One generation shall praise Your works to another
    and shall declare Your mighty acts.
145.5:
I will speak of the glorious honor of Your majesty
    and of Your wondrous works.
145.6:
They shall speak of the might of Your awesome acts,
    and I will declare Your greatness.
145.7:
They shall abundantly declare the fame of Your great goodness
    and shall sing of Your righteousness.
145.8:
The Lord is gracious and full of compassion,
    slow to anger, and great in mercy.
145.9:
The Lord is good to all,
    and His compassion is over all His works.
145.10:
All Your works shall praise You, O Lord,
    and Your godly ones shall bless You.
145.11:
They shall speak of the glory of Your kingdom
    and talk of Your power,
145.12:
to make known to people His mighty acts,
    and the glorious majesty of His kingdom.
145.13:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
    and Your dominion endures throughout all generations.
145.14:
The Lord upholds all who fall,
    and raises up all who are bowed down.
145.15:
The eyes of all wait upon You,
    and You give them their food in due season.
145.16:
You open Your hand
    and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
145.17:
The Lord is righteous in all His ways
    and loving in all His works.
145.18:
The Lord is near to all those who call upon Him,
    to all who call upon Him in truth.
145.19:
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him;
    He also will hear their cry and will save them.
145.20:
The Lord preserves all those who love Him,
    but all the wicked He will destroy.
145.21:
My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord,
    and let all people bless His holy name
    forever and ever.

146.1:
Praise the Lord! 
Praise the Lord, O my soul!
146.2:
While I live I will praise the Lord;
    I will sing praises unto my God while I have my life.
146.3:
Do not put your trust in princes,
    nor in a son of man, in whom there is no help.
146.4:
His breath leaves him, and he returns to the earth;
    on that very day his plans perish.
146.5:
Blessed is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
    whose hope is in the Lord his God,
146.6:
who made heaven, and earth,
    the sea, and all that is in them,
    who keeps faithfulness forever,
146.7:
who executes justice for the oppressed,
    who gives food to the hungry.
The Lord releases the prisoners.
146.10:
The Lord shall reign forever,
    your God, O Zion, unto all generations. 
Praise you the Lord!

147.2:
The Lord builds up Jerusalem;
    He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
147.3:
He heals the broken in heart,
    and binds up their wounds.
147.4:
He counts the number of the stars;
    He calls them all by their names.
147.5:
Great is our Lord and great in power;
    His understanding is without measure.
147.6:
The Lord lifts up the meek;
    He casts the wicked down to the ground.
147.7:
Sing unto the Lord with thanksgiving;
    sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
147.8:
who covers the heaven with clouds,
    who provides rain for the earth,
    who makes grass to grow upon the mountains.
147.9:
He gives food to the animals
    and to the young ravens that chirp.
147.10:
He delights not in the strength of the horse,
    nor does He take pleasure in the legs of a man,
147.11:
but the Lord takes pleasure in those who fear Him,
    in those who hope in His mercy.
147.12:
Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem;
    praise your God, O Zion.
147.13:
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates;
    He has blessed your children within you.
147.14:
He makes peace in your borders,
    and fills you with the finest of the wheat.
147.15:
He sends forth His commandment on the earth;
    His word goes out swiftly.
147.16:
He gives snow like wool;
    He scatters the frost like ashes;
147.17:
He casts forth His ice like morsels;
    who can stand before His cold?
147.18:
He sends out His word and melts them;
    He causes His wind to blow and the waters flow.
147.19:
He shows His word to Jacob,
    and His statutes and His judgments to Israel.

148.2:
Praise Him, all His angels;
    praise Him, all His heavenly hosts.
148.3:
Praise Him, sun and moon;
    praise Him, all you stars of light.
148.4:
Praise Him, you highest of heavens,
    and you waters that are above the skies.
148.5:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
    for He commanded, and they were created.
148.6:
He has also established them forever and ever;
    He has made a decree that shall not pass away.
148.7:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
    you great sea creatures, and all you depths,
148.8:
fire and hail, snow and mist,
    storming wind fulfilling His word,
148.9:
mountains and all hills,
    fruitful trees and all cedars;
148.10:
animals and all cattle,
    creeping things and flying birds;
148.11:
kings of the earth and all peoples,
    princes and all rulers of the earth;
148.12:
both young men and maidens,
    old men and children.
148.14:
He has raised up a victory horn for His people,
    praise for all His saints,
    even for the people of Israel near Him. 
Praise the Lord!

149.1:
Praise the Lord! 
Sing unto the Lord a new song,
    and His praise in the assembly of the godly ones.
149.2:
Let Israel rejoice in its Maker;
    let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
149.3:
Let them praise His name with dancing;
    let them sing praises unto Him with the tambourine and harp.
149.4:
For the Lord takes pleasure in His people;
    He will beautify the meek with salvation.
149.5:
Let the godly ones be joyful in glory;
    let them sing for joy on their beds.
149.6:
Let the high praises of God be in their mouths,
    and two-edged swords in their hands,
149.7:
to execute vengeance on the nations,
    and punishments on the peoples;
149.8:
to bind their kings with chains,
    and their nobles with shackles of iron;

150.2:
Praise Him for His mighty acts;
    praise Him according to His excellent greatness!
150.3:
Praise Him with the sound of the trumpet;
    praise Him with the lyre and harp!
150.4:
Praise Him with the tambourine and dancing;
    praise Him with stringed instruments and flute!
150.5:
Praise Him with loud cymbals;
    praise Him with the clanging cymbals!
150.6:
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. 
Praise the Lord!
